<h3>Honours and Distinctions</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>


<li>Selected for 42nd International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry
(IUPAC) Young Chemist Award (Programme B), by the Royal Society of
Chemistry (RSC), UK, in conjunction with the 42nd IUPAC Congress that was
held from 2 - 7 August 2009 in Glasgow, Scotland, UK.</li>

<li> Selected for poster presentation at the IUPAC 42nd Congress: Chemistry
Solutions, August 2-7, 2009 in Glasgow, Scotland, UK.</li>

<li>Selected at ACS PRF Summer School on Computation, Simulation and Theory
in Chemistry, Chemical Biology, and Materials Chemistry, June 11-18, 2005
in Park City, Utah, USA.</li>

<li>Selected for travel grant from the organizers of ACS PRF Summer School
on Computation, Simulation, and Theory in Chemistry, Chemical Biology and
Materials Chemistry, June 11-18, 2005 in Park City, Utah, USA.</li>

<li>Selected for poster presentation at the Gordon Research Conference on
Chemical Reactions at Surfaces in Ventura Beach Marriott Ventura, CA, USA,
February 13-18, 2005.</li>

<li>Selected for poster presentation at the Gordon Research Conference on
Molecular Energy   Transfer in Buellton California, USA, January 10-14
2005.</li>

<li>Selected for travel grant from Department of Science and Technology,
Government of India for poster presentation at the Gordon Research
Conference on Molecular Energy Transfer in Buellton, California, January
10-14 2005.</li>

<li>Selected for travel grant from Council of Scientific and Industrial
Research, New Delhi, India for poster presentation at the Gordon Research
Conference on Molecular Energy Transfer in Buellton California, USA,
January 10-14 2005.</li>

<li>Selected for Gordon-Kenan Graduate Research Seminar on Molecular Energy
Transfer in Buellton California, USA, January 8-9 2005.</li>

<li>Senior Research Fellowship, awarded by the Council of Scientific and
Industrial Research, India (2000 - 03) on the basis of research done as
Junior Research Fellow.</li>

<li>Junior Research Fellowship and eligibility for lectureship, awarded by
the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, India (1997 - 99) on
the basis of an all India Examination.</li>

<li>Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE - 1997), Conducted by Indian
Institute of Technology (IIT), Percentile score: 99.24, All India Rank -
12.</li>

<li> National Scholarship: Awarded by Department of Education, Ministry of
Human Resource Development, Government of India, on the basis of B. Sc.</li>
Exam. result (1995).

<li>National Scholarship: Awarded by Department of Education, Government of
West Bengal, India, on the basis of Higher Secondary Exam. result (1992).</li>


</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publications</h3>
<div class="data" align="justify">
<h4>Papers</h4>
<ul><li> Chaos in molecular vibrations, A. Chakraborty [to be submitted] (2013). </li>
<li> Vibrational excitation in the C60 single molecule transistor: effective Hamiltonian approach, F. Schäfer & A. Chakraborty [to be submitted, 2013]. </li>
<li> Pre-dissociation of diatomic molecule: Analytical treatment, Diwaker & A. Chakraborty [submitted] (2012). </li>
<li>  Effect of curve crossing induced dissociation on absorption and resonance Raman spectra: Analytical treatment, Diwaker & A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. [under revision] (2012). </li>
<li> Nonadiabatic Transitions: Analytically solvable models (review article), Diwaker and A. Chakraborty [to be submitted] (2013). </li>
<li> Multi-channel scattering problems - Analytically Solvable Model, Diwaker & A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 110, 2257 (2012).</li>
<li> Curve Crossing Problem with Gaussian type Coupling: Analytically Solvable Model, Diwaker & A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 110, 2197 (2012).</li>
<li> Buckled nano rod: A two state system and quantum effects on its dynamics using system plus reservoir model, A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 109, 517 (2011). </li>
<li>  Nonadiabatic tunneling in an ideal one dimensional semi-infinite periodic potential systems: An analytically solvable model, A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 109, 429 (2011). </li>
<li> Multi-channel curve crossing problems: Analytically solvable model, A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 107, 2459 (2009). </li>
<li> Buckled nano rod: A two state system and quantum effects on its dynamics, A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 107, 1777 (2009). 
<li> Curve crossing effects on absorption and resonance Raman spectra: Analytical treatment for a delta-function coupling in parabolic potentials, A. Chakraborty, Mol. Phys. 107,165 (2009). </li>
<li>Effective Hamiltonian for Chaotic Coupled Oscillators, A. Chakraborty & M. E. Kellman, J. Chem. Phys. 129, 71104 (2008) (comm.). </li>
<li>Buckled nano rod: A two state system and its dynamics, A. Chakraborty, S. Bagchi & K. L. Sebastian, J. Comput. Theor. Nanosci. 4, 504 (2007). </li>
<li>The dynamics of solvation of an electron in the image potential state by a layer of polar adsorbates, K. L. Sebastian, A. Chakraborty & M. Tachiya, J. Chem. Phys. 123, 214704 (2005) (Selected for publication in the Virtual Journal of Ultrafast Science). </li>
<li>A continuum approach to electron solvation by a layer of polar adsorbates, K. L. Sebastian, A. Chakraborty & M. Tachiya, J. Chem. Phys. 119, 10350 (2003). 
<li>Dynamics of vibrational excitation in the C60 single molecule transistor, A. Chakraborty, K. Kumar & K. L. Sebastian, Phy. Rev. B 68, 085411 (2003). (Selected for publication in the Virtual Journal of Nanoscale Science & Technology.)</li>
</ul>

<h4>Books</h4>

</li>

Publishing, Germany (2010).
</li>

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Design and Synthesis of Metal Organic Frameworks (MOFs)</li>
<li>Evaluation of MOFs for molecular recognition</li>
<li>Design and Syntheis of Calix[4]arene and Thiacalix[4]arene based fluorescent sensors for ion and
molecular recognition and construction of Photonic Switches, Logic Gates and Devices
</li>

</div>
</div>

<div id="data_bottom">
<div class="data_field">
<h3><b>Research Interests</b></h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Nanobiotechnology </li>
<li>Nanomaterial synthesis and characterization (Metallic nanoparticles, Quantum dots, Polymeric nanoparticles and composites)</li>
<li>Nanoparticle based Theranostics</li>
<li>Nanosensors (Chemical and Biological sensors)</li>
<li>Plasmonic nanostructures and SERS</li>
<li>DNA Nanotechnology</li>
<li>Bioimaging</li>
<li>Enzymology</li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>



<div class="data_field">
<h3>Education</h3>


<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Ph.D. in Nanotechnology from IIT Guwahati in 2013</li>
<li>M.Tech. in Biotechnology from IIT Guwahati in 2010</li>
<li>B.Tech.in Biotechnology from Heritage Institute of Technology (W.B.U.T.) in 2008</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

  <h3>Projects/Awards</h3>
  <div class="data">
    <ul>
      <li>Simons Associate Award of ICTP, Trieste, Italy starting from Jan 1, 2015 </li>
      <li>CSIR- RA (Direct Award) </li>
      <li>Research project entitled &quot;<b>Advanced computational studies of dynamic phenomena in magnetic nano-materials</b>&quot; under &quot;2008 India- European commission coordinated (joint) call for proposal in Computational Material Science&acirc;&euro;&#157; program.  Collaborating institutes with in India are: SN Bose Institute, Kolkata, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Indian Institute of Sciences Bangalore and IIT Mandi, Mandi. The Collaborating partners from Europe are: Univ of Exeter in UK, Univ of Southampton, UK, Univ of Ferrara, Italy and AMU, Poland. The starting date of the project is June 1, 2009. The project was for three years but extended till March, 2013. </li>
      <li>Research project entitled &quot;<b>Computational engineering of nano materials</b>&quot; is currently running under Nano Mission scheme of Department of Science &amp; Technology, Government of India. The project started on Sept 1, 2009. The project was for three years but it is extended till Feb 2013. </li>
      <li>The research project entitled &quot;<b>Structured Programming through e-Learning</b>&quot; is sanctioned under International Higher Education Programme of British Council. The partner institutes are IIT Mandi, IIT Madras and University of Southampton, UK. The starting date of the project is Sept 1, 2012.</li>
      <li>The collaborative project &quot;<b>India-UK Advanced Technology Centre (IU-ATC)</b>&quot; is sanctioned to a consortium of Institutes in India and UK. IIT Mandi is one partner in this consortium. Starting date of the project is Aug 1, 2012.
        <p><b><i>My role in all these projects: Principal Investigator</i></b></p>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</div>
<div class="data_field large_df">
  <h3>Centers and labs set up in IIT Mandi </h3>
  <div class="data">
    <ul>
      <li>
        <h4>Center for Innovative Technologies for Himalayan Region (CITHR)</h4>
      </li>
CITHR is set up at IIT Mandi under the DST sanctioned project for doing the Scoping study to set up CSTRI Center at IIT Mandi. This is new scheme of DST to promote technology penetration in rural India. The activity started on Sept 1, 2012.<br />
<li>
  <h4>Aakash Application Development Lab (AADL)</h4>
</li>
AADL is set up for developing various  application oriented projects on android platform entitled &quot; Aakash Application Development Lab (AADL): Applications for Scalable Teaching in Engineering&quot; sanctioned through the lead Institute, IIT Madras, under the Centrally Sponsored Plan Scheme of <b>National Mission on Education through Information and Communication Technology</b>. Starting date of the project is Aug 1, 2012.
    </ul>
  </div>
</div>
<div class="data_field">

<h3>Courses Taught </h3>
<div class="data">

<li>Database Management Systems (Core course in CSE)</li>
	<li>Computer Networks (Core course in CSE)</li>
	<li>Computer Programming (Core course in CSE)</li>
	<li>Data Structure and Algorithms (Institute Core)</li>
	<li>Distributed Databases (Elective)</li>
	<li>Nanomagnetism (Elective)</li>
	<li>Electronic Properties of Materials (Elective)</li>
	<li>Magnetic Materials (Elective)</li></ul>

  <h3><b>Research Students</b></h3>
  <div class="data">
    <ul>
      <li><b>Ph D Students</b>
        <p>Mr Tushar Rana (Co supervised, shared with a faculty at LNMIIT, Jaipur) : working on magnetic clusters.</p>
        <p>Ms Renu  : working on Magnetoelectric effect, Joined in Feb 2014</p>
        <p>Mr Sanjay Rathi : working in Big data analystics, Joined in Dec2013</p>
        <p>Mr Imran Ahmed, Joined in August, 2014</p>
        <p>Mr Rohit Pathak, Joined in August 2014</p>
      </li>
    </ul>
    <p><b>Past Students</b>
    </p>
    <blockquote>
      <p>Dr Pankaj Kumar Sahota : Completed his PhD entitles &quot;ab initio, micromagnetic and analystic studies of mangetic nanostructures&quot;, <strong>Currently Posdoc at UNL, Lincoln, NE USA</strong></p>
      <p>Dr Priyanka Manchanda : Completed her PhD entitled &quot;Magnetic properties of Multilayers and some bulk alloys: An ab initio Study&quot; ,  <strong>Currently Posdoc at UNL, Lincoln, NE USA.</strong></p>
      <p>Dr Vinit Sharma:  worked as Postdoc , <strong>Currently Postdoc at University of Connecticut, USA</strong>. </p>
      <p>Mr Abhishek Sharma : Completed thesis entitled &quot;Collinear and non-Collinear Magnetism: A comparative study of Various Manganese Nitrides using ab initio theoretical calculations&quot; for his Integrated B.Tech.-M.Tech. dual degree course at  Centre for Converging Technologies, University of Rajasthan, Jaipur during 2011-2012.<br />
      </p>
      <p>Mr Ravi Kumar : Completed thesis entitled  &quot;Design and development of utility software tools and their applications to enhance functionality of scientific codes NMAG and USPEX&quot; for his Integrated B.Tech.-M.Tech. dual degree course at Centre for      Converging Technologies, University of Rajasthan, Jaipur during 2011-2012. </p>
      <p>Ms Kriti Bhargava: Completed  her thesis entitled &quot;Wireless sensor network based advisory system for Apple Scab prevention&quot; for her integrated MTech program at LNMIIT, Jaipur., <strong>Curently PhD student at Waterford Institute of Technology, Ireland </strong></p>

    <h4>&nbsp;</h4>
  </li>
</ol>

<div id="data_bottom">
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>
Bionanotechnology (peptide based bio-nano hybrids for device applications)</li>
<li>Energy science (bio-inspired materials for green energy, sustainable bio-catalysis)</li>
<li>Surface science (Langmuir monolayers, LB/LS films and inorganic thin films)</li>
<li>X-ray science (Reflectivity, GIXD, SAXS and XAFS)</li>
<li>Facilities development (specialized instrumentation for synchrotrons) </li>
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>





<div class="data_field">
<h3>Education</h3>


<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Ph.D. (Physical Chemistry) from University of Stuttgart, Stuttgart, Germany in 2006</li>
<li>M.Sc. (Materials Science) from P.S.G. College of Technology, Coimbatore, India in 2002</li>
<li>B.Sc. (Applied Sciences) from P.S.G. College of Technology, Coimbatore, India in 2000</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">
<h3>Experience </h3>
<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Assistant Professor at IIT Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, India (Apr. 2012 onwards)</li>
<li>Research Associate at National Institute for Materials Science, Japan (Jun. 2010 to Mar. 2012)</li>
<li>Postdoctoral Researcher at University of Pennsylvania, U.S.A. (Oct. 2006 to May 2010)</li>
<li>Teaching Assistant at University of Stuttgart, Germany (Apr. 2003 to Oct. 2006)</li>


</ul></div>

<div class="data_field">

<div id ="left_column">

<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Pradeep Kumar</h2>

<div id="data_container">

<div id="data">

<div id="data_top">

<img src="images/pkumar.JPG" alt="Dr. Pradeep Kumar"/>



<div id="contact_info">

<table>

<th>Phone : </th>   <td>01905-237931</td>

</tr>

<tr>

<th>EMail : </th>	<td>pkumar[at]iitmandi[dot]ac[dot]in</td>

</tr>

<tr>

<div id="data_bottom">

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Optical properties of low-dimensional systems (Carbon nano-tubes, Graphene, Graphene based heterostructures, nano-particles etc).</li>
<li>Strongly correlated systems - Multiferroic oxides, Iron-based superconductors, Topological insulators, Spin-frustrated systems.</li>
<li>Raman measurement and mapping of stress and strain in thin films.</li>
<li>Surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS).</li>


</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Ph.D (Physics, 2014), IISc, Bangalore, India.</li>
<li>M.Sc (Physics, 2007), School of Physical Sciences, JNU, Delhi, India.</li>
<li>B.Sc (Physics, 2005), Hansraj College, University of Delhi, Delhi, India.</li>
</ul></div>

</div>


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publication in Journals</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Pradeep Kumar, D.V.S. Muthu, L. Harnagea, C. Hess, S. Wurmehl, S. Singh, B. Buchner and A.K. Sood, “Phonon anomalies, Orbital-ordering and electronic Raman Scattering in iron-pnictide Ca(Fe0.97Co0.03)2As2: Temperature-dependent Raman Study”. J. Phys. : Cond. Matter 26, 305403 (2014).</li>
<li> Pradeep Kumar, S. Ghara, B. Rajeshwaran, D.V.S. Muthu, A. Sundaresan and A.K. Sood, “Temperature dependent magnetic, dielectric and Raman studies of partially disordered La2NiMnO6”. Solid State Commun. 184, 47 (2014). </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, D.V.S. Muthu, J. Prakash, A.K. Ganguli and A.K. Sood, “Raman Evidence for Coupling of Superconducting Quasi-Particles with a Phonon and Crystal Field Excitation in Superconductor Ce0.6Y0.4FeAsO0.8F0.2”. AIP Confer. Proce. 1591, 1098 (2014). </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, G. Sriprakash, G. Rukmani, K.P. Ramesh and D.V.S. Muthu, “Anomalous optical phonons in Cs0.9(NH4)0.1H2AsO4 : A temperature-dependent Raman Study”. AIP-Advance 6, 062123 (2013). </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, A. Bera, D.V.S Muthu, P.M. Shirage, A. Iyo and A.K. Sood, “Superconducting fluctuations and anomalous phonon renormalization much above superconducting transition temperature in Ca4Al2O5.7Fe2As2”, Appl. Phys. Lett. 100, 222602 (2012). </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, A. Bera, D.V.S. Muthu, S.N. Shirodkar, R. Saha, A. Shireen, A. Sundaresan, U.V. Waghmare, A.K. Sood and C.N.R. Rao, “Coupled phonons, magnetic excitations and ferroelectricity in AlFeO3: Raman and First-principles Studies”, Phys. Rev. B 85, 134449 (2012). </li>
<li>G.K. Pradhan, A. Bera, Pradeep Kumar, D.V.S. Muthu and A.K. Sood, “Raman signature of pressure induced electronic topological and structural transition in Bi2Te3”, Solid State Commun. 152, 284 (2012). </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, A. Bera, D.V.S. Muthu, A. Kumar, U.V. Waghmare, L.  Harnagea, C. Hess, S. Wurmehl, S. Singh, B. Buchner and A.K. Sood, “Raman evidence for superconducting gap and spin-phonon coupling in superconductor Ca(Fe0.95Co0.05)2As2”, J. Phys. : Cond. Matter 23, 255403 (2011). </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, A. Kumar, S. Saha, D.V.S. Muthu, J. Prakash, U.V. Waghmare, A.K. Ganguli and A.K. Sood, “Temperature-dependent Raman study of CeFeAsO0.9F0.1 superconductor: crystal field excitations, phonons and their coupling”, J. Phys. : Cond. Matter 22, 255402 (2010).   • Also selected for the “Lab Talk Section” in J. Phys. : Cond. Matter entitled “Phonons, quasiparticle excitations and their coupling in iron-pnictides”. </li>
<li>Pradeep Kumar, A. Kumar, S. Saha, D.V.S. Muthu, J. Prakash, S. Patnaik, U.V. Waghmare, A.K. Ganguli and A.K. Sood, “Anomalous Raman scattering from phonons and electrons of superconducting FeSe0.82”, Solid State Commun. (Fast Track) 150, 557 (2010). </li>
<li> Pradeep Kumar, S. Saha, D.V.S. Muthu, J.R.  Sahu, A.K. Sood and C.N.R.  Rao, “Raman evidence for orbiton-mediated multiphonon scattering in multiferroic TbMnO3”, J. Phys. : Cond. Matter 22, 115403 (2010). </li>
<li> Pradeep Kumar, S. Saha, C.R. Serrao, A.K. Sood and C.N.R. Rao, “Temperature-Dependent infrared reflectivity studies of multiferroic TbMnO3: Evidence for spin-phonon coupling”, Pramana J. Phys. 74, 281 (2010). </li>
<li>A. Kumar, Pradeep Kumar, U.V. Waghmare and A.K. Sood, “First-principles analysis of electron correlation, spin ordering and phonons in the normal state of FeSe1-x”, J. Phy.:Cond.Matter 22,385701 (2010).
</ul></div>

</div>

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Nonlinear dynamics and Chaos 
</li><li>Mathematical modeling 
</li><li>Patterns and waves in ecology
</li><li>Epidemiology
</li><li>Mathematical biology
</li><li>Differential equations
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div  class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
</li><li>PhD in Applied Mathematics from Indian School of Mines Dhanbad, 2009, Thesis title: Modelling the dynamical complexities in diffusion driven ecological systems
</li><li>MPhil in Applied Mathematics from Indian School of Mines Dhanbad, 2006, Thesis title: Exploring the dynamic nature of ecological complexity: a dynamical system approach 
</li><li>MSc in Mathematics & Computing from Indian School of Mines Dhanbad, 2005
</li><li>BSc in Mathematics (Honours) from Vinoba Bhave University, Hazaribag, 2002
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div  class="data_field">

<h3>Experience</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Assistant Professor, School of Basic Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Mandi, India (since July 2010).</li>
<li>Lecturer of Mathematics in Vinoba Bhave University, Hazaribag (2008-2010) 
</li><li>National Doctoral Fellow of All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Govt. of India (2007-2008)
</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div  class="data_field">

<h3  class="data_field">Awards</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Qualified Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) Exam, 2007 with a merit position first in Jharkhand state.
</li><li>National Doctoral Fellowship awarded by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Govt. of India (2007 - 2008), granted only to 50 PhD students every year in India selected on the basis of their research aptitude.
</li><li>Junior Research Fellowship awarded by Indian School of Mines Dhanbad on the basis of an all India examination (2006 -2007).
</li><li>Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE - 2006) with percentile score 91 and All India Rank - 213.
</li>

</ul></div>

</div>

<div  class="data_field">

<h3>Research Publications</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Pattern Formation in Spatially Extended Tri-trophic Food Chain Model
Systems: Generalist vs. Specialist top predator, ISRN Biomathematics, In
Press, 2013.
</li>

<li>Some aspects of animal behavior and community dynamics, Computational Ecology and Software,Vol. 1, No.3, pp. 153-182, 2011. (with V. Rai, R. K. Upadhyay, S. N. Raw)</li>
<li>Modeling spatiotemporal dynamics of vole populations in Europe and America, Mathematical Biosciences (Elsevier), Vol. 223, pp. 47-57, 2010. (with R.K. Upadhyay & V. Rai)</li>
<li>Wave phenomena and edge of chaos in a predator-prey system under Allee effect, Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems (Springer-Verlag), Vol. 13, No. 3, pp. 301-317, 2009. (with R.K. Upadhyay & V.Rai)</li>
<li>Exploring dynamical complexity in diffusion driven predator-prey systems: effect of toxin producing phytoplankton and spatial heterogeneities, Chaos Solitons and Fractals (Elsevier), Vol. 42,  pp. 584-594, 2009. (with R.K. Upadhyay & V.Rai)</li>
<li>Wave of chaos in a diffusive system: Generating realistic patterns of patchiness in plankton fish dynamics, Chaos Solitons and Fractals (Elsevier), Vol. 40, No. 1, pp. 262-276, 2009. (with R.K. Upadhyay & V.Rai)</li>
<li>Spatiotemporal pattern formation in a diffusive predator-prey system: An analytical approach, Journal of Applied Mathematics and Computing (Springer-Verlag), Vol. 31, pp. 413-432, 2009. (with B.Dubey & R.K. Upadhyay)</li>
<li>Wave of chaos and pattern formation in a spatial predator-prey system with Holling type IV functional response, Mathematical Modelling in Natural Phenomena, Vol. 3, No. 4, pp. 71-95, 2008. (with R.K. Upadhyay & V.Rai)</li>
<li>Modelling the spread of Bird Flu and predicting outbreak diversity, Nonlinear Analysis: Real World Applications (Elsevier), Vol. 9, pp. 1638-1648, 2008. (with R.K. Upadhyay & V.S.H. Rao) [This research paper was at number 1 position in Science Direct Top 25 Hottest Articles in April-June 2008]</li>
<li>Dynamical complexity in some ecological models: effect of toxin production by phytoplankton, Nonlinear Analysis: Modelling and Control, Vol. 12, No. 1, pp. 1-16, 2007. (with R.K. Upadhyay & R.K.Naji)</li>

</ul>
</div>

</div>

<li>Nitu Kumari (2006) Exploring spatiotemporal chaos in aquatic ecological system, paper presented in National Seminar on Recent Advances in Theoretical and Applied Seismology, 20-21 March, ISM, Dhanbad.</li>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Field of Specialisation</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Thin Film Physics and Technology</li>
<li>Amorphous Semiconductors, Charcogenide glasses, Selective Coating.</li>
<li>Dilute magnetic semiconductors, solid state sensors, hydrogenated amorphous silicon and transport conductors.</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Academic Career</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>B.Sc.(Phy. Chem. Math) in 1963 from Punjab/Govt. Degree College, Mandi</li>
<li>M.Sc.(Phy.) in 1966 from IIT Delhi</li>
<li>M.Tech.(Solid State Physics) in 1968 from IIT Delhi</li>
<li>Ph.D(Phy.) in 1971 from IIT Delhi</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

</ul>
</div>

<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Kaustav Mukherjee </h2>
<div id="data_container">
<div id="data">
<div id="data_top"><img src="images/kaustav.jpg" height="180px" alt="Dr. Kaustav Mukherjee"/>
<div id="contact_info">

<div id="data_bottom">
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Education </h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Ph.D. (in Experimental Condensed Matter Physics): UGC-DAE Consortium for Scientific Research, Indore, India.</li>
<li>M.Sc. (in Physics): Calcutta University, Kolkata, India.</li>
</ul></div></div>
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Areas of Interest</h3>
<ul>
   <li>Magnetic, transport and thermodynamic properties of oxides and rare earth intermetallics; nanostructured magnetic oxides and intermetallics; low dimensional and frustrated magnetic compounds; functional materials like mutiferroics, magnetic refrigerant materials, materials exhibiting colossal magnetoresistance, shape memory alloys </li>
   
</ul>
<h3>Work Experience</h3>
<ul>
<li>Assistant Professor, School of Basic Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Mandi, India (from 2013)</li>
<li>Post Doctoral Fellow, Osaka University, Osaka, Japan [2012-2013]</li>
<li>Post Doctoral Fellow, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Mumbai, India [2009-2012]   </li>
</ul>

<h3>Awards</h3>
<ul>
<li>Post Doctoral Fellowship, Osaka University, Japan (funded by NEDO), 2012</li>
<li>Post Doctoral Fellowship, TIFR, India, 2009</li>
<li>GATE, India 2002</li>
<li>CSIR-NET, India 2002</li>
</ul>
</div></div>
<div class="data_field">
<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publications in Referred Journals</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>

<li>Observation of different spin behavior with temperature variation and Cr substitution in a multiferroic compound YMn2O5<br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kranti Kumar and A. Banerjee<br>Solid State Commun. <b>153</b>, 66 (2013).</li><br>

<li>On the correlation between supercooling, superheating and kinetic arrest in a magnetic glass Pr0.5Ca0.5Mn0.975Al0.025O3<br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kranti Kumar, A. Banerjee and P. Chaddah<br>Eur. Phys. J. B ,  <b>86</b>, 21 (2013).</li><br>

<li>The nature of 4f magnetism in the diluted ferromagnetic Kondo lattice, CeIr2B2 <br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K. Iyer, and E. V. Sampathkumaran<br>J. Phys.: Condens. Matter <b>24</b>, 266006 (2012).</li><br>

<li>Magnetic anomaly in CeIn2<br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K Iyer and E.V. Sampathkumaran<br>J. Phys. Condens. Matter <b>24</b>, 096006 (2012).</li>
<br>

<li>Magnetic anomalies in single crystalline Tb5Si3<br>Kartik K. Iyer, <b>K. Mukherjee</b>, P.L. Paulose, E.V. Sampathkumarana, Y. Xu, W. Loser<br>Solid State Commun. <b>152</b>, 522 (2012).</li><br>

<li>A first-order magnetic phase transition near 15 K with novel magnetic-field-induced effects in Er5Si3<br>Niharika Mohapatra, <b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K Iyer and E. V. Sampathkumaran<br>J. Phys. Condens. Matter <b>23</b>, 496001 (2011).</li><br>



<li>Magnetocaloric effect in Tb5Si3: Sign reversal and non-monotonic variation with temperature and implications<br>Niharika Mohapatra, Sitikantha D Das, <b>K. Mukherjee</b> and E. V. Sampathkumaran<br>Solid State Commun. <b>151</b>, 1340 (2011).</li><br>

<li>Glasslike ordering and spatial inhomogeneity of magnetic structure in Ba3FeRu2O9: Role of Fe/Ru site disorder<br>Srimanta Middey, Sugata Ray, <b>K. Mukherjee</b>, P. L. Paulose, E. V. Sampathkumaran, C. Meneghini, S. D. Kaushik, V. Siruguri, K. Kovnir and D. D. Sarma<br>Phys. Rev. B. <b>83</b>, 144419 (2011).</li><br>

<li>Evolution of a metastable phase with magnetic phase-coexistence phenomenon and its unusual sensitivity to magnetic-field cycling in the alloys, Tb5-xLuxSi3 (x <= 0.7)<br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K Iyer and E.V. Sampathkumaran<br>J. Phys. Cond Mat <b>23</b>, 206002 (2011)  </li><br>

<li>Magnetism of nano particles of Kondo lattices, obtained by high-energy ball-milling<br>E.V. Sampathkumaran, <b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K Iyer, Niharika Mohapatra and Sitikantha D. Das <br>J. Phys. Cond Mat <b>23</b>, 094209 (2011).</li><br>

<li>Enhanced electrical resistance at the field-induced magnetic transitions in some non-stoichiometric and stoichiometic Tb-based ternary germanides<br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K Iyer and E.V. Sampathkumaran<br>J. Phys. Condens. Matter <b>23</b>, 066003 (2011).</li><br>

<li>An anomalous butterfly-shaped magnetoresistance loop in an alloy, Tb4LuSi3 <br><b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Sitikantha D Das, Niharika Mohapatra, Kartik K Iyer, E.V.  Sampathkumaran<br>Phys. Rev. B. <b>81</b>, 184434 (2010).</li><br>

<li>Influence of pressure on the magnetic behavior and the anomalous magnetoresistance in Tb5Si3<br>Niharika Mohapatra, Sitikantha D. Das, <b>K. Mukherjee</b>, Kartik K. Iyer, and E. V. Sampathkumaran<br>Phys. Rev. B <b>80</b>, 214425 (2009).</li><br>

<li>Excess specific heat and evidence of zero-point entropy in magnetic glassy state of half-doped manganites<br>A. Banerjee,  R. Rawat, <b>K. Mukherjee</b>, and P. Chaddah   <br>Phys Rev. B <b>79</b>, 212403 (2009).</li><br>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Time resolved Single Molecule Förster Resonance Energy Transfer (smFRET) </li>

<li>Developing Optical Tweezers</li>

<li>Single Particle Tracking and imaging</li>

<li>Real time protein folding dynamics</li>

<li>Characterization of DNA aptamers for therapeutics</li>

<li>Synthesis and characterization of quantum dots</li>

</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>PhD in Physical Chemistry from Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, 2006</li>

<li>MSc in Physical Chemistry from Burdwan University, West Bengal, 2000</li>

<li>BSc (Chemistry Honors) from  Bankura Christian College, West Bengal,1998</li>

</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Experience</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Post Doctoral Research Associate at Geothe Universität, Frankfurt Main (2006-2009)</li>

</ul></div>

</div>



<div class="data_field large_df">

<div class="data_field large_df">

<h3>Publications</h3>

<div class="data">

<ul>

<li>Nandi C. K., Parui P. P., Schmidt T. L., Heckel, A. and Brutschy B., (2008): Binding of hairpin polyamides to DNA studied by fluorescence correlation spectroscopy for DNA nanoarchitectures. Anal. Bioanal. Chem. 390, 1595-1603.</li>

<li>Nandi C. K., Parui P. P., Brutschy, B., Scheffer U., and Göbel M. (2008): Fluorescence Correlation Spectroscopy at single molecule level on the Tat-TAR complex and its inhibitors. Biopolymers 89, 17-25</li>

<li>Schmidt T. L., Nandi C. K., Rasched G., Parui P. P., Brutschy B., Famulok M., and Heckel A. (2007): Polyamide struts for DNA architectures. Angew. Chem. Int. Ed. 46, 4382-4384.</li>

<li>Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T. (2005): Conformational effects and level mixing in a doubly hydrogen-bonded 1:1 dimer of acetic acid and 3-fluorobenzoic acid.  J. Indian Inst. Sci. 85, 367-379. </li>

<li>Nandi C. K., Samanta, A. K., and Chakraborty T. (2005): Identification of isomeric dimers of o-fluorobenzoic acid using laser-induced fluorescence spectroscopy. Chem. Phys. Lett. 416, 261-267</li>

<li>Nandi C. K., Hazra, M. K., and Chakraborty T. (2005): Vibrational coupling in carboxylic acid dimers.  J. Chem. Phys. 123, 124310-1 - 124310-7. </li>

<li>Chervenkov S., Wang, P.Q., Braun J. E., Georgiev S., Neusser H. J., Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T. (2005): High-resolution Ultraviolet Spectroscopy of p-fluorostyrene water: evidence for a s-type hydrogen-bonded dimer. J. Chem. Phys. 122, 244312-1 – 244312-7.</li>

<li>Pradhan B., Singh B. P., Nandi C. K., Chakraborty T ., and Kundu T. (2005): Origin of methyl torsional barrier in 1-Methyl 2-(1H)-Pyridone.  J. Chem. Phys. 122, 204323-1 - 204323-9.</li>

<li>Nandi C. K., Hazra M. K., and Chakraborty T. (2004):  Hydrogen bond mediated rotor-ring coupling in acetic acid-benzoic acid mixed dimer.  J. Chem. Phys. 121, 7562-7564. </li>

<li>Nandi C. K., Hazra M. K., and Chakraborty T. (2004):  Conformational effects on vibronic spectra and excited state dynamics of 3- fluorobenzoic acid dimer.  J. Chem. Phys. 121, 5261-5271. 
</li>

<li>Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T. (2004):  Hydrogen bond–induced vibronic mode mixing in benzoic acid dimer: A laser- induced fluorescence study.  J. Chem. Phys. 120, 8521-8527.</li>

<li>Das A., Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T. (2003): Structure and electronic spectroscopy of naphthalene-acenaphthene van der Waals dimer: Hole burning, dispersed fluorescence, and quantum chemistry calculation. J. Chem. Phys.118, 9589-9595.</li>

<li>Das A., Mahato K. K., Nandi C. K., Chakraborty T., Gadre S. R., and Gokhale N. A. (2002): Exciplex emission from the mixed dimer of naphthalene and 2-cyanonaphthalene in a supersonic jet.  Phys.Chem.Chem.Phys. 4, 2162-2168. 
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>





<div class="data_field large_df">

<h3>Conferences And Symposia</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Nandi C. K., Berth, H. –D., Brutschy, B. (2008):  "Fluorescence Correlation Spectroscopy at single molecule level on the Tat-TAR complex and it's inhibitors". SFB-579 RNA-Ligand interaction, J. W. Geothe University, Frankfurt, Germany, March 12-14. p 61  </li>

<li>Nandi C. K., Brutschy, B. (2007):  "Fluorescence Correlation Spectroscopy at single molecule level on the Tat-TAR complex and it's inhibitors". International symposium on SFB-579 RNA-Ligand interaction, J. W. Geothe University, Frankfurt, Germany, September 27-29. p 55  </li>

<li>Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty, T. (2005): "Hydrogen bond mediated intramolecular vibrational energy redistribution and intermolecular electronic energy transfer in carboxylic acid dimmers". 7th CRSI National Symposium in Chemistry (CRSI 2005), Indian Association for the Cultivation of Science, Kolkata, India, February 4-6. p 217 </li>

<li>Chakraborty T., and Nandi, C. K. (2004): "Hydrogen bond mediated vibronic mode mixing and electronic energy transfer in benzoic acid dimmers". 59th Ohio State University International Symposium on Molecular spectroscopy 2004, Ohio State University, Columbus, USA. June 21-24. p39 (WG 11). Identifier:<a href="http://hdl.handle.net/1811/21503"> http://hdl.handle.net/1811/21503</a>.  </li>

<li>Nandi C. K., and Chakraborty T.  (2003): "Vibronic mode mixing in hydrogen-bonded dimers of benzoic acid and substituted benzoic acid: Laser-induced fluorescence study in supersonic jet". National Symposium on Radiation and Photochemistry (NSRP-2003), Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, India. March 3-5. p 38</li>

</li>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Exciton dynamics in quantum dots (QDs) and multiple exciton generation</li>
<li>Optoelectronics of graphene</li>
<li>Spectroscopy of organic and hybrid materials</li> 
<li>Organic photovoltaics: materials and devices</li>
<li>Calculations on surfaces and nanostructured materials</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Ph. D., Indian Association for the Cultivation of science (IACS), Degree offered by  Jadavpur University, 2006
</li><li>M.Sc. (Physics), The University of Burdwan, 1997
</li><li>B.Sc. (Physics Hons.), The University of Burdwan, 1995
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Experience</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Post Doctoral Research Fellow, Bowling Green State University, USA (2009-2010)
</li><li>Post Doctoral Research Fellow, Lund University, Sweden (2007-2009)
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field large_df">

</li>
</ul></div>

<h3>Publications</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>

<li>Kumar, P.; <b>Pal, S. K.</b> Role of decoupled defect transitions of ZnO nanocrystals in energy transfer <i>J. Photobiol. Photochem. A: Chem.</i> <b>2014</b>, <i>278</i>, 46.

<li>Chakraborti, H.; Sinha, S; Ghosh, S; <b>Pal, S. K.</b> Interfacing water soluble nanomaterials with fluorescence chemosensing : graphene quantum dot to detect Hg2+ in 100% aqueous solution <i>Mater. Lett.</i> <b>2013</b>, <i>97</i>, 78.</li>
<li><b>Pal, S. K.</b>;  Mereshchenko, A. S.;  Butaeva, E. V.; El-Khoury, P. Z.;  Tarnovsky, A. N. Global sampling of the photochemical reaction paths of bromoform
by ultrafast deep-UV through near-IR transient absorption and ab initio multiconfigurational calculations <i>J. Chem. Phys.</i> <b>2013</b>, <i>138</i>, 124501.</li>

<li><b>Pal, S. K.</b>; Mereshchenko, A. S.; El-Khoury, P.; Tarnovsky, A. N.  Femtosecond photolysis of CH2Br2 in acetonitrile: capturing the bromomethyl radical and bromine-atom charge transfer complex through deep-to-near UV probing <i>Chem. Phys. Lett.</i> <b>2011</b>, <i>507</i>, 69.</li>

<li><b>Pal, S. K.</b>; Sundström, V.; Galoppini, E.; Persson, P. Calculations of Interfacial Interactions in Pyrene-Ipa Rod Sensitized Nanostructured TiO2 <i>Dalton Trans.</i> <b>2009</b>, 10021.</li>
<li><b>Pal, S. K.</b>; Bhattacharya, S.; Batabyal, S. K.; Ganguly , T. Role of TiO2 nanoparticles on the photoinduced intramolecular electron transfer reaction within a novel synthesized donor-acceptor system <i>J. Photochem. Photobiol. A:  Chem.</i>  <b>2007</b>, <i>189</i>, 86.  </li>
<li>Mandal, P.; Sahu, T.; Misra, T.; <b>Pal, S. K.</b>; Ganguly, T. Experimental Investigations by using electrochemical, steady state and time resolved spectroscopic tools on     the photoreactions of disubstituted indoles in presence of  Tetracyanoquinodimethane (TCNQ) And a Theoretical Approach by Using Time-Dependent Density Functional Theory <i>J.    Photochem. Photobiol.   A: Chem.</i>  <b>2007</b>, <i>188</i>, 235.</li>

<li><b>Pal, S. K.</b>; Batabyal, S. K.; Ganguly, T. Preparation and photophysical properties of nanostructured 9-cyanoanthracene  <i>Chem. Phys. Lett.</i>  <b>2005</b>, <i>406</i>, 420.</li>

A: Chem.</i>  <b>2005</b>, <i>174</i>, 138.</li>

<div id="data_bottom">

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Areas of Interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Polyoxometalate Chemistry</li>
<li>Organic-Inorganic Hybrids</li>
<li>Self-assembly of Nano-sized Clusters</li>
<li>Ligand Design</li>
<li>Chiral Metal Complexes</li>
<li>Asymmetric Catalysis</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Ph.D in Inorganic Chemistry, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India 2001-06
<br/>Thesis title: "Studies on Mn, Co and Cu complexes of Chiral Amino Alcohol based Schiff bases: Synthesis, Structure and Properties"</li>
<li>M. Sc Chemistry, University of Calicut, Kerala,India 1998-2000. </li>
<li>B. Sc Chemistry, University of Calicut, Kerala, India 1995-98. </li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Professional Experience</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Assistant Professor, IIT Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, India 2010-present</li>
<li>Post-Doctoral Research in Inorganic/Materials/Nano-Chemistry University of Glasgow, Glasgow, UK 2006-2010</li>

</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Research Interest</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Quantum Optics</li>
<li>Quantum Information</li>
<li>Nanophotonics</li>
<li>Mesoscopic Physics</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>PhD from Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, India.</li>
<li>MSc (Physics) from Agra University, Agra, India.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>


<div class="data_field">
<h3>Work Experience</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>07/ 2008- 12/2010 Postdoctoral Fellow   Queen’s University,Kingston, Ontario, Canada.</li>
<li>06/ 2007 –07/ 2008 Postdoctoral Fellow 	Chonnam National University, Gwangju, South-Korea.</li>
<li>12/ 2006- 06/ 2007 Postdoctoral Fellow   Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India.</li>
<li>09/ 2004 – 12/ 2006  Research-Associate  Oklahoma State University, Stillwater, Oklahoma, USA.</li></li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<div class="data_field">


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>List of Publications</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li><b>Generation of time-bin entangled photon pairs using a quantum-dot cavity system</b>, P. K. Pathak and S. Hughes, submitted, arXiv:1010.1713.</li>
<li><b>Coherently triggered single photons from a quantum-dot cavity system</b>, P. K. Pathak and S. Hughes, Phys. Rev. B 82, 045308 (2010).</li>
<li><b>Nonlinear photoluminescence spectra from a quantum-dot cavity system: Interplay of pump-induced stimulated emission and anharmonic cavity QED</b>, P. Yao, P. K. Pathak, E. Illes, S. Hughes, S. Munch, S. Reitzenstein, P. Franeck, A. Loffler, T. Heindel, S. Hofling, L. Worschech, and A. Forchel, Phys. Rev. B 81, 033309 (2010).</li>
<li><b>Cavity-QED assisted attraction between a cavity mode and an exciton mode in a planar photonic-crystal cavity</b>, T. Tawara, H. Kamada, T. Tanabe, T. Sogawa, H. Okamoto, P. Yao, P. K. Pathak, and S. Hughes, Opt. Express 18, 2719 (2010).</li>
<li><b>High sensitivity charge detection and dephasing in edge state interferometer</b>, P. K. Pathak, Youngnae Lee, and Kicheon Kang, Physica E 42, 1103 (2010).</li>
<li><b>Cavity-assisted fast generation of entangled photon pairs through the biexciton-exciton cascade</b>, P. K. Pathak and S. Hughes, Phys. Rev. B 80, 155325 (2009).</li>
<li><b>Comment on "Entanglement on Demand through Time Reordering"</b>, P. K. Pathak and S. Hughes, Phys. Rev. Lett. 103, 048901 (2009).</li>
<li><b>Generation of entangled photon-pairs from a single quantum dot embedded in a planar photonic-crystal cavity</b>, P. K. Pathak and S. Hughes, Phys. Rev. B 79, 205416 (2009).</li>
<li><b>Edge-state Fabry-Perot interferometer as a high sensitivity charge detector</b>, P. K. Pathak and Kicheon Kang, Phys. Rev. B 79, 233302 (2009).</li>
<li><b>The Quadratic Spin Squeezing Operators</b>, P. K. Pathak, R. N. Deb, N. Nayak, and B. Dutta-Roy, J. Phys. A.41, 145302 (2008).</li>
<li><b>Realization of quantum mechanical weak values of observables using entangled photons</b>, G. S. Agarwal and P. K. Pathak, Phys. Rev. A.75, 032108 (2007).</li>
<li><b>Quantum random walk of two photons in separable and entangled states</b>, P. K. Pathak and G. S. Agarwal, Phys. Rev. A 75, 032351 (2007).</li>
<li><b>Quantum random walk of the field in an externally driven cavity</b>, G. S. Agarwal and P. K. Pathak, Phys. Rev. A 72, 033815 (2005).</li>
<li><b>Generation of a superposition of multiple mesoscopic states of radiation in a resonant cavity</b>, P. K. Pathak and G. S. Agarwal, Phys. Rev. A 71, 043823 (2005).</li>
<li><b>Dc-field-induced enhancement and inhibition of spontaneous emission in a cavity</b>, G. S. Agarwal and P. K. Pathak, Phys. Rev. A 70, 025802 (2004).</li>
<li><b>Large two-atom two-photon vacuum Rabi oscillations in a high-quality cavity</b>, P. K. Pathak and G. S. Agarwal, Phys. Rev. A 70, 043807 (2004).</li>
<li><b>Mesoscopic Superposition of States with Sub-Planck Structures in Phase Space</b>, G. S. Agarwal and P. K. Pathak, Phys. Rev. A 70, 053813 (2004).</li>
<li><b>Single-atom and two-atom Ramsey interferometry with quantized fields</b>, G. S. Agarwal, P. K. Pathak, and M. O. Scully, Phys. Rev. A 67, 043807 (2003).</li>
</ul>
</div>

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Electronic structure and local structure properties of strongly correlated electron systems using photoemission and x-ray absorption spectroscopic techniques.
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Ph.D. from UGC-DAE consortium for scientific research, Indore (2005)
</li><li>M.Sc. from Pondicherry Central University, Pondicherry (1997)
</li><li>B.Sc. from Assumption College (Mahatma Gandhi University), Changanacherry (1995)
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

</li><li>Visiting Fellow, National Center for Biological Sciences, India [5 months, 2005]
</li>
</ul></div>

<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publications</h3>
<div class="data">
<ol>
<li>Electronic structure of EuFe2As2<br> Ganesh Adhikary, Nishaina Sahadev, Deepnarayan Biswas, <b>R. Bindu</b>, Neeraj

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<li>Isolation of Natural products from Medicinal Plants</li>

</ul></div>

<div class="data_field">

<li>BSc (1997-2000) in Chemistry from University of Madras</li>

</ul></div>

<h3>Areas of Interest</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Numerical Methods for PDEs</li>
<li>Computational Fluid dynamics</li>
<li>Two-Phase Modeling and Sediment Transport</li>
<li>Mathematical Image Processing</li>
<li>Stochastic Differential-Algebraic Equations</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>PhD in Mathematics from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, 2009.<br />
Thesis title: Some New Directions in HOC Methodology: Tackling Circular Geometries (Advisor: Dr.
Jiten C. Kalita)</li>
<li>MSc in Mathematics from Visva-Bharati University, Shantiniketan, 2003</li>
<li>BSc in Mathematics (Honours) from Visva-Bharati University, Shantiniketan, 2001</li>
</ul>

<h3>Journal Publications</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul type="1">

<li> Jain SK, <b>Ray RK.</b>. A Non-Linear Diffusion based Partial Differential Equation Model For Noise Reduction in Images. Springer AISC Series <b>(Accepted)</b>. </li>

<li> <b>Ray RK</b>, Kalita JC. Higher-Order-Compact Simulation of Unsteady Flow Past a Rotating Cylinder at Moderate Reynolds Numbers. Comp. Appl. Math. <b>(Accepted)</b>.</li>

<li>Mittal HVR, <b>Ray RK.</b> A New Direction to Higher Order Compact (HOC) Scheme for Solving Immersed Interface Problems. Procedia IUTAM (Elsevier) <b>(Accepted)</b>. </li>

<li> Jain SK, <b>Ray RK.</b>, Bhavsar A. A Comparative Study of Iterative Solvers for Image De-noising. Springer AISC Series <b>(Accepted)</b>. </li>

<li>Mittal HVR, <b>Ray RK.</b> A Transform Free Higher Order Compact Finite Difference Scheme for Simulating the Flow behind a Rotationally Oscillating Circular Cylinder at Reynolds number 500. Applied Mechanics and Materials, 367:126-131, 2013. </li>

<li> Shi Yu-e, <b>Ray RK</b>, Nguyen KD. A Projection Method-based model with the exact C-property for shallow-water flows over dry and irregular bottom using unstructured finite-volume technique. Computers & Fluids, 76:178-195, 2013.</li>

<li><b>Ray RK</b>, Mittal HVR. A Transform-Free HOC Scheme for Incompressible Viscous Flow past a Rotationally Oscillating Circular Cylinder. World Academy of Science, Engineering and Technology, 72:1365-1371, 2012.</li>

<li><b>Ray RK</b>. A Transformation-free HOC Scheme for Incompressible viscous Flow Past a Rotating and Translating Circular Cylinder. Journal of Scientific Computing, 46(2):265-293, 2011.</li>

<li><b>Ray RK</b>, Nguyen KD. An Unstructured Finite-volume Technique for Shallow-water Flows with Wetting and Drying Fronts. World Academy of Science, Engineering and Technology, 71:682-687, 2010.</li>

<li><b>Ray RK</b>, Kalita JC. A transformation-free HOC scheme for incompressible viscous flows on nonuniform polar grids. International Journal for Numerical Methods in Fluids, 62:683-708, 2010.</li>

<li>Kalita JC, <b>Ray RK</b>. A transformation-free HOC scheme for incompressible viscous flow past an impulsively started circular cylinder. Journal of Computational Physics, 228:5207-5236, 2009.</li>

<li> <b>Ray RK</b>, Kalita JC, Dass AK. An efficient HOC scheme for transient convection-diffusion-reaction equations with discontinuous coefficients and singular source terms. Proc. Appl. Math. Mech., 7(1):1025603-1025604, 2007.</li>

<li> Jain SK, Ray RK, Bhavsar A. A Comparative Study of Iterative Solvers for Image De-noising. <b>Under review</b>.</li>

<li> Tyagi S, Abbas S, Ray RK. Stability and Bifurcation analysis of Cellular Neural Networks with Discrete and Distributed delays. <b>Under review</b>. </li>

<li> Ray RK, Mittal HVR. Study of Unsteady, Incompressible, Viscous Flow Past a Rotationally Oscillating
Circular Cylinder Using Higher Order Compact Finite Difference Scheme. <b>Submitted</b>.</li>

<li> Ray RK, Kalita JC, Mittal HVR. An efficient higher order accurate scheme for Elliptic Equations with Discontinuities. <b>Submitted</b>.</li>

<li> Tyagi S, Abbas S, Ray RK.  Dynamical analysis of integro differential equation model of ring neural networks with delay. <b>Submitted</b>. </li>


</ul>
</div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">
<h3>Research interests</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Polymer and noble metal nanostructures
</li><li>Nanocrystallisation of simple organic compounds
</li><li>High energetic materials
</li><li>Heterogeneous catalysis
</li><li>Thermal analysis and calorimetry.
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">
<h3>Education</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li>
Ph.D. in Chemistry from DDU Gorakhpur University in high energetic materials (2003).
</li><li>M.Sc. in Chemistry (Polymer Science) from Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam (1999).
</li><li>B.Sc. in Chemistry from University of Kerala (1996).
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

</li><li>Marie-Curie International Incoming Postdoctoral Fellow, University of Paris-Sud, France (2007-2009)
</li><li>Postdoctoral fellow, University of Huddersfield, UK (2004-2007)
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">
<h3>Scientific Programmes Organised</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Co-ordinator - AICTE/MHRD sponsored summer school on "Nanoscience and Technology (NANO-2010)", 31st May - 4th June, 2010, NIT Hamirpur.
</li><li>Co-ordinator - MHRD sponsored community development programme "Challenges and Opportunities in Science and Technology" for motivating school children, 14-18, June 2010, NIT Hamirpur
</li><li>Organising Secretary - National Conference on "Advances in Polymer Science and Technology (APST-2010)" to be held at NIT Hamirpur during 22-24 October, 2010.
</li>
</ul></div>

<h3>Group Members</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li> Doctoral Student : Somnath Acharya
<li> For internships: Institute invites applications for internship. Keep an eye on the timely advertisements.  
</li><li> Students interested to work in the exciting field of Experimental Condesnsed Matter Physics, Nanoscience & Nanotechnology are welcome to join Indian Institute of Technology Mandi
 
 <a href= "http://www.iitmandi.ac.in/admissions/ms_phd_admiss.html"> For ADMISSIONS </a> 
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>


<div class="data_field">
<h3>Research Facilities </h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li> Facility for bulk materials synthesis by melt grown method, </a> 
<li> Facility for solution growth for metallic nanomaterials and semiconducting quantum dots, </a> 
 <li> Central Research Facility at IIT Mandi
 <a href= "http://www.iitmandi.ac.in/research/facilities.html"> Research Facility </a> 
</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Tulika Prakash Srivastava </h2>
<div id="data_container">
<div id="data">
<div id="data_top"><img src="images/tulika.jpg" width="180" height="200px" alt=Dr. Tulika Prakash Srivastava" />

<div id="data_bottom">
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Research Interests: </h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Metagenomic sequencing and analysis of highthroughput sequence data obtained from different environments, including human body sites, soil, sediment, etc.</li>
<li>Complete genome sequencing and analysis of novel bacteria inhabiting different environments.</li>
<li>Development of computational tools and algorithms for metagenomic and genomic data analysis.</li>
<li>Development of novel algorithms for functional prediction of unknown/hypothetical proteins.</li>
<li>Human genome analysis and comparative genomics.</li>


</ul></div></div>
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Educational </h3>
<div class="data"><br />
<ul>
<li>Ph.D. (in Bioinformatics): 2000 - 2005 under the supervision of Prof. Samir K Brahmachari at the Institute of Genomics and Integrative Biology (IGIB), CSIR, Delhi, India, registered at the University of Delhi, India
Thesis Title: Comparative Genomics and In Silico Functional Analysis of Prokaryotic Genomes
</li>
<li>M.Sc. 2yr (Chemistry): 1998 - 2000, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kanpur, India	</li>
<li>B.Sc. (H) (Chemistry: 1995 - 1998, Miranda House, University of Delhi, Delhi-110007, India. </li></ul></div></div>
<div class="data_field">

<div class="data_field">
<h3>Experience</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<table width="100%" border=".50"><tr><th>Positions Held</th><td>Period</th><th>Laboratory</td></tr>
<tr><td>Research Scientist</td><td>Oct 2010 - July 2012</td><td>Laboratory for MetaSystems Research, Computational Biology Research Core, Quantitative Biology Center (QBiC), RIKEN, Yokohama,Japan.</td></tr>
<tr><td>Postdoctoral Researcher</td><td>Apr 2008 - Sept 2010</td><td>MetaSystems Research Team, Advanced Science Institute, RIKEN, Yokohama, Japan</td></tr>
<tr><td>Postdoctoral Researcher</td><td>Apr 2006 - Mar 2008</td><td>Genome Annotation and Comparative Analysis Team, Computational and Experimental Systems Biology Group, Genomic Sciences Center, RIKEN, Yokohama, Japan</td></tr>
<tr><td>Senior Research Fellow</td><td>2003 - Mar 2006</td><td>G N Ramachandran Knowledge Center, Institute of Genomics and Integrative Biology, CSIR, Delhi, India</td></tr></table></ul></div></div>

<div class="data field">
<h3>Honors and Awards</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Received Ramalingaswamy Fellowship 2012 from Department of Biotechnology DBT) for five years.</li>
<li>Received CSHL Young Scientist Award to attend CSHL Genome Informatics Meeting 2006 held in Hinxton, UK.</li>
<li>Received HUGO Student Award to attend Human Genome Meeting 2005 held in Kyoto, Japan.</li>
<li>First prize for poster presentation entitled "Comprehensive Peptide Signature Database (CoPS)" in the Annual Symposium in Biomedical Sciences, University of Delhi, April 2003.</li>
</ul></div></div>

<div class="data_field" align="justify">
<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publications</h3>
<div class="data">

<ol type="1,2">


<li><b>Functional assignment of metagenomic data: challenges and applications</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Taylor TD.<b> Briefings in Bioinformatics</b> (Epub ahead of print):1-17. (July 6, 2012). <br>(This resource is a thorough review of methods used for metagenomic functional analysis, the challenges in the field with recommendations for possible solutions, and the various applications of the field)</li>
<li><b>Fast and accurate taxonomic assignments of metagenomic sequences using MetaBin."</b> Sharma VK, Kumar N, <b>Prakash T</b>, Taylor TD. <b>PLoS ONE</b> 7(3):e34030. (April 4, 2012)</li>
<li><b>Complete genome sequences of rat and mouse segmented filamentous bacteria, a potent inducer of Th17 cell differentiation</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Oshima K, Morita H, Fukuda S, Imaoka A, Kumar N, Sharma VK, Takahashi M, Saitou N, Taylor TD, Ohno H, Umesaki Y, Hattori M. <b>Cell Host & Microbe</b> 10(3):273-284.</li> 
(September 15, 2011) (Cover Page Article)<br>
(This is the first report of the complete genome sequence of novel and yet unculturable microbe SFB, which is known to play an important role in regulating intestinal immunity. The study also helped in proposing the possible mechanism of its action.)</li>
<li><b>Expression of Conjoined Genes: Another Mechanism for Gene Regulation in Eukaryotes</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Sharma VK, Adati N, Ozawa R, Kumar N, Nishida Y, Fujikake T, Takeda T, Taylor TD. <b>PLoS One</b> 2010 5(10), e13284.<br>(First report on thorough identification and characterization of a novel type of gene found in eukaryotic genomes. The study resulted in the curation of the first comprehensive web resource of CGs from human genome and in proposing the various roles they can play.)</li>
<li><b>MetaBioME: a database to explore commercially useful enzymes in metagenomic datasets."</b> Sharma VK, Kumar N, <b>Prakash T</b>, Taylor TD. <b>Nucleic Acids Research</b> 38(Database):D468-D472. (November 11, 2009) </li>
<li><b>Genome of an endosymbiont coupling N2 fixation to cellulolysis within protist cells in termite gut</b>. Hongoh Y*, Sharma VK*, <b>Prakash T</b>, Noda S, Toh H, Taylor TD, Kudo T, Sakaki Y, Toyoda A, Hattori M, Ohkuma M. <b>Science</b> 2008 322(5904):1108-1109.</li>
<li><b>Complete genome of the uncultured Termite Group 1 bacteria in a single host protist cell.</b> Hongoh Y*, Sharma VK*,<b>Prakash T</b>, Noda S, Taylor TD, Kudo T, Sakaki T, Toyoda A, Hattori M, Ohkuma M. Proc Natl Acad Sci USA 2008 105(14):5555-5560.</li>

<li><b>Comparative metagenomics revealed commonly enriched gene sets in human gut microbiomes</b>. Kurokawa K, Itoh T, Kuwahara T, Oshima K, Toh H, Toyoda A, Takami H, Morita H, Sharma VK, <b>Srivastava TP</b>, Taylor TD, Noguchi H, Mori H, Ogura Y, Ehrlich DS, Itoh K, Takagi T, Sakaki Y, Hayashi T, Hattori M.<b> DNA Research</b>, 2007, 14(4), 169-181.</li>
<li><b>Structural assessment of glycyl mutations in invariantly conserved motifs</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Sandhu KS, Singh NK, Bhasin Y, Ramakrishnan C, Brahmachari SK. <b>Proteins: Structure, Function and Bioinformatics</b>, 2007, 69(3), 617-632.</li>
<li><b>Conformational Analysis of Invariant Peptide Sequences in Bacterial Genomes</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Ramakrishnan C, Dash D, Brahmachari SK. <b>J. Mol. Biol.</b> 2005, 345, 937-955.</li>
<li><b>CoPS: comprehensive peptide signature database</b>. <b>Prakash T</b>, Khandelwal M, Dasgupta D, Dash D, Brahmachari SK. <b>Bioinformatics</b>, 2004, 20(16), 2886-2888.</li>
<li><b>In silico characterization of the INO80 subfamily of SWI2/SNF2 chromatin remodeling proteins</b>. Bakshi R, <b>Prakash T</b>, Dash D, Brahmachari V. <b>Biochem Biophys Res Commun.</b> 2004, 320(1), 197-204.</li>
<li><b>Recognition and analysis of protein-coding genes in severe acute respiratory syndrome associated coronavirus</b>. Sharma R, Maheshwari JK, <b>Prakash T</b>, Dash D, Brahmachari SK. <b>Bioinformatics</b>, 2004, 20(7), 1074-1080.</li>
</ol>
<h4>


</div>
</div>

</ul></div></div></div>
<div class="data field">
<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Conferences and Symposia</h3>
<div class="data">
<h4>ORAL PRESENTATIONS DELIVERED</h4>
<ul>
<li><b>14th Human Genome Meeting 2010</b>. Montpellier, France, May 18-21, 2010.  Title: "Chromosomal conformation patterns govern the formation of conjoined genes in eukaryotic genomes." </li>
<li><b>The 12th International Symposium on Microbial Ecology, ISME12</b>. Cairns, Australia. Aug 17-22, 2008. Title: "Novel approach for the annotation of unannotated proteins in metagenomic datasets."</li>
<li><b>Indo-Brazil-South Africa (IBSA) Trilateral Workshop on "Functional Genomics, Life Science, GM Food and Agriculture"</b> organized by DST and IGIB (CSIR) in July 2005, held at the Institute of Genomics and Integrative Biology.</li>
<li><b>Human Genome Meeting 2005</b> organized by the Human Genome Organization in April 2005, held at Kyoto, Japan, title: Conservation of invariant peptides in split genes.</li>
<li><b>International Conference on Mathematical Biology 2004</b> at Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, India, title: Identification and functional analysis of invariant peptide signatures in prokaryotes using comparative genomics.</li>

</ul>
<h4>POSTER PRESENTATIONS, SYMPOSIUMS AND WORKSHOPS ATTENDED</h4>

<div id ="left_column">



<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Hari Varma</h2>

<div id="data_container">

<div id="data">

<div id="data_top">

<img src="images/hari.jpg"HEIGHT="200" WIDTH="150"  alt="Dr. Hari Varma"/>



<div id="contact_info">

<table>

<tr>

<th>Phone : </th>   <td>01905-300064</td>

</tr>

<tr>

<th>EMail : </th>	<td>hari[at]iitmandi[dot]ac[dot]in</td></tr>

<tr>

</tr>

<tr>

<th>Address : </th><td>School of Basic Sciences</td>

</tr>

<tr><th></th><td>IIT Mandi, Kamand Campus,</td></tr>

<tr><th></th><td> Mandi - 175005</td></tr>

<tr><th></th><td>India</td></tr>

</table>

</div>

</div>

<div id="data_bottom">

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Photoionization studies of many-body systems</li>
<li>Photoionization studies of atoms trapped in fullerene cage</li>
<li>Above threshold ionization studies (ATI) of atoms under ultra-intense x-ray radiation</li>
</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>PH.D. from I.I.T. Madras, Chennai(2008)
<li>M.Sc. from I.I.T. Madras, chennai(2002)
<li>B.Sc. from M.G. University, kerala(2000)
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Work experience</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>Assistant Professor, IIT Mandi (2010-present)
<li>Post-doctoral fellow, National Taiwan University, Taipei (2009-2010)
<li>Post-doctoral fellow, Argnonne National Laboratory, U.S.A (2008-2009)
</li>
</ul></div>

</div>


<div class="data_field">


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Books/Book Chapters</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li> Photoabsorption processes in some free and confined atomic systems: Effects of Correlation, Relativistic Interactions and Confinement,<br>
Hari R Varma and P. C. Deshmukh,<br>
Lambert Academic Publishing,Germany, 2011.</li><br>

<li> Autoionization resonances in mercury atom,<br>
Sindhu Kalyadan, Hari R. Varma and P.C. Deshmkh,<br>
Electron Collision Processes in Atomic and Molecular Physics, <br>
Edited by P.C.Minaxi Vinodkumar, Narosa Publications, ISBN 978-81-8487-343-6, 104-108 (2014).</li><br>

<li> Ashish Kumar, Sindhu Kalyadan, H. R. Varma and P. C. Deshmukh,<br> 
Quadrupole effects in the low energy photoionization of the 3s subshell of Mg@C60,<br> 
Electron Collision Processes in Atomic and Molecular Physics, <br>
Edited by P.C.Minaxi Vinodkumar, Narosa
Publications, ISBN 978-81-8487-343-6, Page no.-168-171(2014).</li>
</ul></div>

</div>


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publications in peer reviewed journals</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>
<li><i>Relativistic effects in photoionization time delay near the Cooper minimum of noble gas atoms, </i><br>
Soumyajit Saha, Ankur Mandal, Jobin Jose, Hari R. Varma,
P. C. Deshmukh, A. S. Kheifets, V. K. Dolmatov and S. T. Manson, <br>
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.90.053406">
Phys. Rev. A. 90, 053406 (2014)</a>
(Selected by the editors of Physical Review A to be an Editors' suggestion)</li><br>

<li><i>Photoionization of Ca 4s in a spherical attractive well potential: Dipole, quadrupole and relativistic effects, </i><br>A. Kumar, H. R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh and S. T. Manson,<br>
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1088/0953-4075/47/18/185003">
J.Phys. B: At. Mol. & Opt. Phys. 47 185003 (2014).</a>
</li>
<br>
<li><i> Pronounced effects of interchannel coupling in high-energy photoionization, </i><br/>
 W. Drube,T. Grehk, S. Thiess, G. B. Pradhan, H. R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh and S. Manson,<br>
 <a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-4075/46/24/245006">
 J.Phys. B: At. Mol. & Opt. Phys. 46, 245006 (2013).</a>
</li>
<br>

<li><i>Photoionization of atomic krypton confined in the fullerene C<sub>60</sub>, </i><br>

J. George, H. R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh and S. T. Manson, <br>
<a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-4075/45/18/185001">
J. Phys. B: At. Mol. Opt. Phys., 45, 185001 (2012).</a>
</li> <br>

<li><i>Core Correlation Effects in the Valence Photodetachment of Cu-,</i><br>
J. Jose, H. R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh, S. T. Manson, and V. Radojevic'<br>
Proc. 26th Summer School and International Symposium on the Physics 
of Ionized Gases (SPIG 2012),<br> 
Book of Contributed Papers & Abstracts of Invited Lectures and Progres 
Reports(Contributed Paper), pp. 39-42.</li> <br>

<li><i>Controlling x-rays with light: ultrafast transparency,</i><br>

T. E. Glover, M. P. Hertlein, S. H. Southworth, T. K. Allison, J. van Tilborg, E. P. Kanter,
B. Kr&auml;ssig, H. R. Varma, B. Rude, R. Santra, A. Belkacem, and L. Young,
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/nphys1430"> <br>Nature Physics 6, 69(2010).</a>
</li> <br>

<li><i>Above-threshold ionization in the x-ray regime,</i><br/>
Hari R. Varma, Marcelo F. Ciappina, Nina Rohringer, Robin Santra,
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.80.053424"> <br>Phys. Rev. A 80, 053424(2009).</a>
</li> <br>

<li><i>X-ray-absorption near-edge structure of laser dressed neon,</i><br />
Hari R. Varma, Lin Pan, Donald R. Beck, Robin Santra,
<a href=" http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.78.065401"> <br> Phys. Rev. A 78, 065401(2008).</a>
</li> <br>

<li><i>Theoretical and experimental demonstration of the existence of quadrupole Cooper minima,</i><br />
P. C. Deshmukh, T. Banerjee , H. R. Varma, O. Hemmers, R. Guilllemin, D. Rolles, A.
Wolska, S. W. Yu, D. W. Lindle, W. R. Johnson and S. T. Manson,
<a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-4075/41/2/021002/cites"> <br> J. Phys. B: At. Mol. & Opt. Phys. (Fast Track) 41, 021002(2008).</a>
</li> <br>

<li><i>Confinement, correlation and relativistic effects on the photoionization of 6s subshell of Hg,</i><br />
H. R. Varma, Tanima Banerjee, S. Sunilkumar, P.C. Deshmukh,
S. T. Manson and V. Dolmatov.
<a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/1742-6596/80/1/012025"> <br>
Journal of Physics: Conference Series (JPCS) 80, 012025(2007). </a> </li> <br>

<li><i>Selective interchannel coupling as computational strategy to interpret complex atomic spectrum,</i><br />
H. R. Varma, T. Banerjee and P. C. Deshmukh,
Special Issue of Indian Journal of Physics 81, 1069(2007).</li> <br>

<li><i>Correlation and relativistic effects on the photoionization of confined atoms,</i><br />
H. R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh, V. K. Dolmatov and S. T. Manson,
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.76.012711"> <br> Phys. Rev. A 76, 012711(2007).</li> <br> </a>

<li><i>Resonance-induced deviations of beta from 2.0 for rare gas s-subshell photoionization,</i><br />
S. B. Whitteld, R. Wehlitz, H. R. Varma, T. Banerjee, P. C. Deshmukh and S. T. Manson,
<a href="http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-4075/39/21/L01"> <br>, J. Phys. B 39, L335(2006).</a> </li> <br>

<li><i>Interchannel coupling effects on non-dipole photoionization parameters,</i><br />
P. C. Deshmukh, Tanima Banerjee, K. P. Sunanda and Hari Varma R.,
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.radphyschem.2005.10.003"> <br>
Radiation Physics and Chemistry 12, 2211(2006).</a> </li> <br> 

<li><i>Absolute photoionization cross sections and resonance structure of doubly ionized silicon in
the region of the 2p<sup>-1</sup> threshold: Experiment and theory,</i><br />
J. -P. Mosnier, M. H. Sayyad, E. T. Kennedy, J.-M. Bizau, D. Cubaynes, F. J. Wuilleumier,
J. -P. Champeaux, C. Blancard, R. Hari Varma, T. Banerjee, P. C. Deshmukh and S. T.
Manson,<br> 
<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.68.052712">Phys. Rev. A 68, 052712(2003).</a> 
</li>

</ul></div>
</div>

<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Presentations in conferences (Posters/Talks)</h3>
<div class="data"><ul>

<li>Photoabsorption studies of some closed-shell ions
in the La isonuclear sequence,<br>
Sindhu Kalyadan,  Hari R. Varma,  P. C. Deshmukh,
John Costello and P. Hayden<br>
The 11th Asian International conference on Atomic and Molecular Physics,
Sendai, Japan, 6-10 October 2014. <br>

<li>Photoionization studies of Cd@C60, <br>
Ashish Kumar, Sindhu Kalyadan, Hari R. Varma, Pranawa C. Deshmukh, Steven T. Manson<br>
The 44th Annual Meeting of the Division of Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics (DAMOP 2013) of the American Physical Society, Cuebec city, Canada, 3-7 June 2013.<br>
<li>Sindhu Kannur, Gagan B. Pradhan, Jobin Jose, Hari R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh and S. T. Manson. Dramatic quadrupole effects in the low energy photoionization of the 4s subshell of free and confined Ca , In The 42nd Annual Meeting of the Division of Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics (DAMOP 2012) of the American Physical Society held at Anaheim, California, June 4-8 2012</li>

<li>Jobin Jose, Sindhu Kannur, Ashish Kumar, Hari R. Varma, P. C. Deshmukh and S. T. Manson. Time delay in photoionization near Cooper minimum, In The 42nd Annual Meeting of the Division of Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics (DAMOP 2012) of the American Physical Society held at Anaheim, California, 2012.</li>

<li> Ashish Kumar, Sindhu Kannur, Hari R. Varma, and P. C. Deshmukh. Time Delay
Study on Xe@C60; DAE-BRNS Symposium on Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics
IISER Kolkata, 14-17 December 2012.</li>

<li>Sindhu Kalyadan, Ashish Kumar, H. R. Varma, John Costello and P. C. Deshmukh.
Autoionization Resonances in the 6.Xnm Spectral Range; DAE-BRNS Symposium on
Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics IISER Kolkata, 14-17 December 2012.</li>

<li>J. George , Hari R. Varma , P. C. Deshmukh , S. T. Manson. Effect of Interchannel Coupling and Confinement on the Photoionization of Kr. In XXVII International Conference on Photonic, Electronic and Atomic Collisions (ICPEAC 2011) Belfast, Northern Ireland, UK,27 July - 2 August, 2011</li>

<li>T Banerjee , Hari R Varma , P C Deshmukh , S T Manson. Dipole and Quadrupole Photoionization of Intermediate Subshells of Atomic Mercury. In XXVII International Conference on Photonic, Electronic and Atomic Collisions (ICPEAC 2011) Belfast, Northern Ireland, UK,27 July - 2 August, 2011.</li>

<li>Cooper minima in E2 photoionization of xenon,
Gagan Bihari Pradhan, Jobin Jose, Hari R. Varma, T. Banerjee and P. C. Deshmukh,
T. C. on Atomic and Molecular Physics, Sardar Patel Universtiy India, January 3-5(2008).</li>

<li>Some recent studies in the photoionization of free and confined atoms,
INVITED TALK at the XV Ith NCAMP, TIFR, Mumbai, India, january 8-11(2007).</li>

<li>Autoionization resonances in  @Kr and @Xe,
Hari R. Varma and P. C. Deshmukh,
XVI NCAMP, TIFR, Mumbai, Jan 8-11(2007).</li>

<li>E1 & E2 photoionization studies of free and confined cadmium and mercury,
Hari R. Varma, S. Sunil Kumar, Tanima Banerjee and P. C. Deshmukh,
XVI NCAMP, TIFR, Mumbai, Jan 8-11(2007).</li>

<li>Confinement effects on E1 and E2 photoionization of the ns subshells of atomic krypton and xenon
T. Banerjee, Hari R. Varma and P. C. Deshmukh,
XVI NCAMP, TIFR, Mumbai, Jan 8-11(2007).</li>

<li>Spin-polarization of Photoelectrons from Atomic Krypton,
Anand Joshi, Saheer Ahmed, H. R. Varma, T. Banerjee,,S. Majumder, Y. Khajuria, P.C. Deshmukh,
NSSA 2006, Calcutta, Jan 18-20 (2006).</li>

<li>Autoionization resonances in atomic Cd using multi channel quantum defect theory,
Hari R. Varma, Tanima Banerjee, Saheer Ahmed, Anand Joshi, Y. Khajuria, S. Majumder and
P. C. Deshmukh,
T. C. on Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics, IACS, Kolkatta, India, December 21-23(2005).</li>

<li>Interference between dipole excitation and ionization channels in confined atoms,
Hari R.Varma, Y. Khajuria, S. Majumder and P. C. Deshmukh,
T. C. on Atomic and Molecular Physics, IACS, Calcutta, Dec 21-23(2005).</li>

<li>Consequences of quantum confinement on atomic photoionization parameters,
Hari R. Varma and P. C. Deshmukh,
XV NCAMP, Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, India, December 20-23(2004).</li>

<li>Interchannel coupling effects on non-dipole photoionization paramters of atomic xenon and mer-
cury,
Tanima Banerjee, K. P. Sunanda, Hari Varma R, Ummal Momeen, P. C. Deshmukh,
XV NCAMP, Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, India, December, 20-23(2004).</li>

<li>Newly found dynamical effects on photoelectron parameters in the dipole approximation for atomic
Xe,
K. P. Sunanda, Tanima Banerjee, Hari Varma R, Ummal Momeen, P.C.Deshmukh,
XV NCAMP, Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, India, December, 20-23 (2004).</li>

</ul></div>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-parent:"";
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin-top:0in;
	mso-para-margin-right:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:10.0pt;

<p class=Default style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>G. <span class=SpellE>Adikari</span>, D.

style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>Journal

style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>4.<span

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>5. <span style='mso-tab-count:1'> </span><span
class=SpellE><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Magnetoresistance</i></span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'> and Hall effect in Thin films of <span
class=GramE>La<sub>0.67</sub>(</span>Sr<sub>1-x</sub>Ca<sub>x</sub>)<sub>0.33</sub>MnO<sub>3</sub></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>P. <span class=SpellE>Mandal</span>, <b>C.
S. <span class=SpellE>Yadav</span></b>, S.D. <span class=SpellE>Kaushik</span>
and S. <span class=SpellE>Patnaik</span> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>International Conference on Physics near
Mott Transition-2006, Bangalore, India<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#C00000'>Talk/Seminar/Conference
presentation<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=Default style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.5pt;
color:#002060'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt;
mso-list:l5 level1 lfo5'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:11.5pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
color:#002060'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'><span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>High pressure Studies on Fe: A
candidate for triplet superconductivity</span></i><span style='font-size:11.5pt;
color:#002060'> at <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>University of Geneva,
Geneva, Switzerland</b> on April 9, 2013<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt;
mso-list:l5 level1 lfo5'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:11.5pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;

</span></span></span><![endif]><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'>Thermoelectric and Magnetic properties
of the Fe<sub>1+y</sub>Te<sub>1-x</sub>Se<sub>x</sub> superconductor</span></i><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'> at <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>University
of Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland</b> on Oct 4, 2011 <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt'><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt;
mso-list:l5 level1 lfo5'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:11.5pt;

</span></span></span><![endif]><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span

of the Fe <span class=SpellE>chalcogene</span> compound: Fe<sub>1+y</sub>Te<sub>1-x</sub>Se<sub>x</sub></span></i><span
style='font-size:11.5pt;color:#002060'> at <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Max
Planck Institute, Stuttgart, Germany</b> on Sept 16, 2011<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=Default style='margin-left:49.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-31.5pt'><span

</span></span></span><![endif]><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span

<li>31. B.Viswanath, G.Aydogdu, S.Ha and S.Ramanathan, In situ stress relaxation and diffraction studies across the metal insulator transition in epitaxial and polycrystalline SmNiO3 thin films, Scripta Materialia, 66(7),463-466 (2012) </li>

<li>25. G.Aydogdu, S.Ha, B.Viswanath and S.Ramanathan; Epitaxy, strain and compositional effects on metal-insulator transition characteristics of SmNiO3 thin films, Journal of Applied Physics, 109, 124110 (2011)</li>

<h3>Conferences</h3>
<div class="data" align="justify">
<ul>

<li>Jana, P. and Chatterjee, A., Power-law damping from dispersed elasto-plastic flaws with Weibull-distributed strengths
 Conference proceedings: 17th US National Congress on Theoretical and Applied Mechanics, Michigan State University, Michigan, USA, 2014.</li>
<li>Jana, P. and Chatterjee, A., Modal damping prediction for vibrating solids: constitutive models and finite element computations,
 Conference poster: Nonlinear Dynamics in Engineering: Modelling, Analysis and Applications, University of Aberdeen, Scotland, UK, 2013.</li>
<li>Jana, P. and Chatterjee, A., Frictional dissipation at a small crack under multiaxial periodic stresses,
 Conference proceedings: 15th National Conference on Machines and Mechanisms (NaCoMM), IIT Madras, 232–239, 2011.</li>
<li>Jana, P. and Bhaskar, K., Buckling of rectangular plates under non-uniform compression using rigorous plane stress solution,
 Conference proceedings: International Conference on Theoretical, Analytical, Computational and Experimental Mechanics (ICTACEM), IIT Kharagpur, 364–366, 2004.</li>

</ul>
</div>
</div>




<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3> Invited Talks</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Jana, P., Modeling and analysis of composite material using FEM.
 Presented at the short term course on Mechanics of Composite and Functionally Graded Materials (MCFGM), NIT Durgapur, December 24–28, 2013.</li>

</ul>
</div>
</div>
