␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀P␀u␀b␀l␀i␀c␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀s␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀h␀5␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀␀
␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀␀
␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀:␀ ␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀R␀a␀o␀,␀ ␀G␀.␀A␀.␀,␀ ␀S␀o␀n␀a␀w␀a␀n␀e␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀R␀.␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀a␀s␀a␀d␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀S␀.␀S␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀9␀ ␀(␀A␀u␀g␀)␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀v␀i␀t␀e␀d␀ ␀p␀a␀p␀e␀r␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀I␀n␀f␀r␀a␀r␀e␀d␀ ␀S␀i␀g␀n␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀S␀t␀u␀d␀i␀e␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀A␀i␀r␀c␀r␀a␀f␀t␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀H␀e␀l␀i␀c␀o␀p␀t␀e␀r␀s␀ ␀(␀p␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀0␀9␀0␀1␀0␀7␀2␀0␀3␀5␀4␀0␀)␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀g␀r␀e␀s␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀E␀l␀e␀c␀t␀r␀o␀m␀a␀g␀n␀e␀t␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀R␀e␀s␀e␀a␀r␀c␀h␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀y␀m␀p␀o␀s␀i␀u␀m␀ ␀(␀P␀I␀E␀R␀S␀-␀2␀0␀0␀9␀)␀,␀ ␀M␀o␀s␀c␀o␀w␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀H␀e␀r␀w␀i␀g␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀8␀ ␀(␀J␀u␀n␀-␀J␀u␀l␀)␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀v␀i␀t␀e␀d␀ ␀p␀a␀p␀e␀r␀:␀ ␀F␀l␀u␀i␀d␀ ␀p␀r␀o␀p␀e␀r␀t␀y␀ ␀v␀a␀r␀i␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀s␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀-␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀8␀t␀h␀ ␀W␀o␀r␀l␀d␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀g␀r␀e␀s␀s␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀C␀o␀m␀p␀u␀t␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀M␀e␀c␀h␀a␀n␀i␀c␀s␀,␀ ␀V␀e␀n␀i␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀I␀t␀a␀l␀y␀;␀ ␀i␀n␀:␀ ␀A␀d␀v␀a␀n␀c␀e␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀m␀u␀l␀t␀i␀p␀h␀y␀s␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀s␀i␀m␀u␀l␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀e␀x␀p␀e␀r␀i␀m␀e␀n␀t␀a␀l␀ ␀t␀e␀s␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀M␀E␀M␀S␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀N␀E␀M␀S␀ ␀(␀I␀D␀:␀ ␀1␀5␀1␀)␀,␀ ␀e␀d␀.␀ ␀A␀.␀ ␀F␀r␀a␀n␀g␀i␀,␀ ␀N␀.␀ ␀A␀l␀u␀r␀u␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀M␀u␀k␀h␀e␀r␀j␀e␀e␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀3␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀R␀a␀o␀,␀ ␀G␀.␀A␀.␀,␀ ␀S␀o␀n␀a␀w␀a␀n␀e␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀R␀.␀,␀ ␀P␀o␀t␀n␀u␀r␀u␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀K␀.␀,␀ ␀K␀o␀l␀h␀e␀,␀ ␀P␀.␀S␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀P␀r␀a␀s␀a␀d␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀H␀.␀S␀.␀S␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀8␀ ␀(␀J␀u␀n␀)␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀v␀i␀t␀e␀d␀ ␀L␀e␀c␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀(␀I␀T␀-␀9␀)␀:␀ ␀I␀n␀f␀r␀a␀r␀e␀d␀ ␀s␀i␀g␀n␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀s␀t␀u␀d␀i␀e␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀i␀r␀b␀o␀r␀n␀e␀ ␀t␀a␀r␀g␀e␀t␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀c␀i␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀T␀e␀c␀h␀n␀o␀l␀o␀g␀y␀,␀ ␀B␀a␀n␀g␀a␀l␀o␀r␀e␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀4␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀H␀e␀r␀w␀i␀g␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀5␀ ␀(␀J␀u␀n␀)␀,␀ ␀M␀o␀d␀i␀f␀i␀e␀d␀ ␀t␀h␀e␀r␀m␀o␀d␀y␀n␀a␀m␀i␀c␀ ␀p␀r␀i␀n␀c␀i␀p␀l␀e␀s␀ ␀u␀n␀i␀f␀y␀i␀n␀g␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀o␀r␀d␀e␀r␀ ␀e␀x␀i␀s␀t␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀e␀v␀o␀l␀u␀t␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀1␀8␀t␀h␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀E␀f␀f␀i␀c␀i␀e␀n␀c␀y␀,␀ ␀C␀o␀s␀t␀,␀ ␀O␀p␀t␀i␀m␀i␀z␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀S␀i␀m␀u␀l␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀E␀n␀v␀i␀r␀o␀n␀m␀e␀n␀t␀a␀l␀ ␀I␀m␀p␀a␀c␀t␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀E␀n␀e␀r␀g␀y␀ ␀S␀y␀s␀t␀e␀m␀s␀ ␀(␀E␀C␀O␀S␀)␀,␀ ␀T␀r␀o␀n␀d␀h␀e␀i␀m␀,␀ ␀N␀o␀r␀w␀a␀y␀;␀ ␀e␀d␀.␀ ␀S␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀K␀j␀e␀l␀s␀t␀r␀u␀p␀,␀ ␀J␀.␀E␀.␀ ␀H␀u␀s␀t␀a␀d␀,␀ ␀T␀.␀ ␀G␀u␀n␀d␀e␀r␀s␀e␀n␀,␀ ␀A␀.␀ ␀R␀␀s␀j␀o␀r␀d␀e␀,␀ ␀G␀.␀ ␀T␀s␀a␀t␀s␀a␀r␀o␀n␀i␀s␀ ␀(␀T␀a␀p␀i␀r␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀U␀t␀t␀r␀y␀k␀k␀,␀ ␀N␀o␀r␀w␀a␀y␀)␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀2␀9␀5␀-␀3␀0␀2␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀5␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀H␀e␀r␀w␀i␀g␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀5␀ ␀(␀J␀u␀n␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀V␀a␀r␀i␀a␀b␀l␀e␀ ␀p␀r␀o␀p␀e␀r␀t␀y␀ ␀e␀f␀f␀e␀c␀t␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀s␀i␀n␀g␀l␀e␀-␀p␀h␀a␀s␀e␀ ␀i␀n␀c␀o␀m␀p␀r␀e␀s␀s␀i␀b␀l␀e␀ ␀f␀l␀o␀w␀s␀ ␀t␀h␀r␀o␀u␀g␀h␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀-␀t␀u␀b␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀3␀r␀d␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀M␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀M␀i␀n␀i␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀,␀ ␀T␀o␀r␀o␀n␀t␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀a␀n␀a␀d␀a␀,␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀ ␀I␀C␀M␀M␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀5␀-␀7␀5␀0␀8␀2␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀6␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀H␀e␀r␀w␀i␀g␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀,␀ ␀H␀a␀u␀s␀n␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀O␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀K␀o␀c␀k␀,␀ ␀F␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀5␀ ␀(␀M␀a␀y␀)␀,␀ ␀S␀c␀a␀l␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀e␀f␀f␀e␀c␀t␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀t␀i␀n␀u␀u␀m␀-␀b␀a␀s␀e␀d␀ ␀l␀a␀m␀i␀n␀a␀r␀ ␀g␀a␀s␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀-␀f␀l␀o␀w␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀d␀u␀e␀ ␀t␀o␀ ␀v␀a␀r␀i␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀g␀a␀s␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀p␀r␀o␀p␀e␀r␀t␀i␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀4␀t␀h␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀C␀o␀m␀p␀u␀t␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀H␀e␀a␀t␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀M␀a␀s␀s␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀T␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀P␀a␀r␀i␀s␀-␀C␀a␀c␀h␀a␀n␀,␀ ␀F␀r␀a␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀e␀d␀.␀ ␀R␀.␀ ␀B␀e␀n␀n␀a␀c␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀A␀.␀A␀.␀ ␀M␀o␀h␀a␀m␀a␀d␀,␀ ␀M␀.␀E␀l␀ ␀G␀a␀n␀a␀o␀u␀i␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀J␀.␀ ␀S␀i␀c␀a␀r␀d␀ ␀(␀L␀a␀v␀o␀i␀s␀i␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀F␀r␀a␀n␀c␀e␀)␀,␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀ ␀1␀2␀0␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀7␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀R␀a␀o␀,␀ ␀G␀.␀A␀.␀,␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀5␀ ␀(␀J␀a␀n␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀A␀i␀r␀c␀r␀a␀f␀t␀ ␀p␀o␀w␀e␀r␀p␀l␀a␀n␀t␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀p␀l␀u␀m␀e␀ ␀i␀n␀f␀r␀a␀r␀e␀d␀ ␀s␀i␀g␀n␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀m␀o␀d␀e␀l␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀A␀n␀a␀l␀y␀s␀i␀s␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀4␀3␀r␀d␀ ␀A␀I␀A␀A␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀S␀c␀i␀e␀n␀c␀e␀s␀ ␀M␀e␀e␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀E␀x␀h␀i␀b␀i␀t␀s␀,␀ ␀R␀e␀n␀o␀ ␀N␀e␀v␀a␀d␀a␀,␀ ␀U␀.␀S␀.␀A␀.␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀A␀I␀A␀A␀-␀2␀0␀0␀5␀-␀0␀2␀2␀1␀ ␀(␀w␀i␀t␀h␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀s␀t␀u␀d␀e␀n␀t␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀8␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀R␀a␀o␀,␀ ␀G␀.␀A␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀4␀ ␀(␀N␀o␀v␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀R␀e␀v␀i␀e␀w␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀s␀t␀e␀a␀l␀t␀h␀ ␀t␀e␀c␀h␀n␀o␀l␀o␀g␀y␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀a␀i␀r␀c␀r␀a␀f␀t␀ ␀I␀R␀ ␀s␀i␀g␀n␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀7␀t␀h␀ ␀N␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀A␀i␀r␀ ␀B␀r␀e␀a␀t␀h␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀E␀n␀g␀i␀n␀e␀s␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀p␀u␀l␀s␀i␀o␀n␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀I␀I␀T␀-␀K␀a␀n␀p␀u␀r␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀3␀4␀5␀-␀3␀5␀8␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀9␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀H␀e␀r␀w␀i␀g␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀H␀a␀u␀s␀n␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀O␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀4␀ ␀(␀M␀a␀r␀)␀,␀ ␀N␀u␀m␀e␀r␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀i␀m␀u␀l␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀1␀-␀D␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀i␀n␀c␀o␀m␀p␀r␀e␀s␀s␀i␀b␀l␀e␀ ␀l␀a␀m␀i␀n␀a␀r␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀s␀c␀a␀l␀e␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀b␀e␀h␀a␀v␀i␀o␀u␀r␀ ␀w␀i␀t␀h␀ ␀t␀e␀m␀p␀e␀r␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀d␀e␀p␀e␀n␀d␀e␀n␀t␀ ␀f␀l␀u␀i␀d␀ ␀p␀r␀o␀p␀e␀r␀t␀i␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀A␀p␀p␀l␀i␀e␀d␀ ␀M␀a␀t␀h␀e␀m␀a␀t␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀M␀e␀c␀h␀a␀n␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀(␀G␀A␀M␀M␀-␀2␀0␀0␀4␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀D␀r␀e␀s␀d␀e␀n␀,␀ ␀G␀e␀r␀m␀a␀n␀y␀)␀,␀ ␀V␀o␀l␀.␀ ␀4␀,␀ ␀N␀o␀.␀ ␀1␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀4␀8␀8␀-␀4␀8␀9␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀0␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀H␀e␀r␀w␀i␀g␀,␀ ␀H␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀H␀a␀u␀s␀n␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀O␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀3␀ ␀(␀S␀e␀p␀)␀,␀ ␀I␀d␀e␀n␀t␀i␀f␀i␀c␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀c␀r␀i␀t␀i␀c␀a␀l␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀c␀o␀p␀e␀:␀ ␀c␀o␀m␀p␀r␀e␀h␀e␀n␀s␀i␀v␀e␀ ␀r␀e␀v␀i␀e␀w␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀s␀c␀a␀l␀e␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀C␀o␀l␀l␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀e␀r␀s␀:␀ ␀9␀t␀h␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀W␀o␀r␀k␀s␀h␀o␀p␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀I␀n␀v␀e␀s␀t␀i␀g␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀I␀C␀s␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀y␀s␀t␀e␀m␀s␀,␀ ␀A␀i␀x␀-␀e␀n␀-␀P␀r␀o␀v␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀F␀r␀a␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀(␀T␀I␀M␀A␀ ␀L␀a␀b␀,␀ ␀G␀r␀e␀n␀o␀b␀l␀e␀,␀ ␀F␀r␀a␀n␀c␀e␀)␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀7␀-␀3␀0␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀1␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀3␀ ␀(␀J␀u␀n␀)␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀v␀i␀t␀e␀d␀ ␀p␀a␀p␀e␀r␀:␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀a␀n␀a␀l␀y␀s␀e␀s␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀c␀e␀p␀t␀s␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀ ␀a␀e␀r␀o␀d␀y␀n␀a␀m␀i␀c␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀h␀e␀a␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀t␀o␀ ␀c␀r␀i␀t␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀u␀r␀f␀a␀c␀e␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀h␀y␀p␀e␀r␀s␀o␀n␀i␀c␀ ␀v␀e␀h␀i␀c␀l␀e␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀d␀e␀r␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀E␀u␀r␀o␀p␀e␀a␀n␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀S␀o␀c␀i␀e␀t␀i␀e␀s␀:␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀d␀y␀n␀a␀m␀i␀c␀s␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀R␀e␀s␀e␀a␀r␀c␀h␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀L␀o␀n␀d␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀U␀.␀K␀.␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀2␀0␀.␀1␀-␀2␀0␀.␀1␀2␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀2␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀3␀ ␀(␀F␀e␀b␀)␀,␀ ␀S␀t␀e␀a␀l␀t␀h␀ ␀t␀e␀c␀h␀n␀o␀l␀o␀g␀y␀ ␀a␀n␀d␀ ␀i␀t␀s␀  ␀r␀o␀l␀e␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀c␀u␀r␀r␀e␀n␀t␀ ␀g␀e␀o␀p␀o␀l␀i␀t␀i␀c␀s␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀X␀X␀V␀I␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀n␀ ␀S␀o␀c␀i␀a␀l␀ ␀S␀c␀i␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀g␀r␀e␀s␀s␀,␀ ␀A␀n␀d␀h␀r␀a␀ ␀U␀n␀i␀v␀e␀r␀s␀i␀t␀y␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀V␀i␀s␀a␀k␀h␀a␀p␀a␀t␀n␀a␀m␀ ␀(␀i␀n␀v␀i␀t␀e␀d␀ ␀l␀e␀c␀t␀u␀r␀e␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀3␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀D␀u␀n␀g␀a␀r␀w␀a␀l␀,␀ ␀R␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀2␀ ␀(␀A␀u␀g␀)␀,␀ ␀N␀u␀m␀e␀r␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀i␀m␀u␀l␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀w␀a␀r␀d␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀g␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀r␀e␀g␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀t␀e␀m␀p␀e␀r␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀f␀i␀e␀l␀d␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀r␀e␀u␀s␀a␀b␀l␀e␀ ␀h␀y␀p␀e␀r␀s␀o␀n␀i␀c␀ ␀v␀e␀h␀i␀c␀l␀e␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀5␀t␀h␀ ␀A␀n␀n␀u␀a␀l␀ ␀C␀F␀D␀ ␀S␀y␀m␀p␀o␀s␀i␀u␀m␀,␀ ␀B␀a␀n␀g␀a␀l␀o␀r␀e␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀,␀ ␀C␀P␀-␀2␀3␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀4␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀2␀ ␀(␀F␀e␀b␀)␀,␀ ␀H␀i␀g␀h␀ ␀p␀e␀r␀f␀o␀r␀m␀a␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀c␀o␀o␀l␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀u␀s␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀ ␀c␀o␀m␀i␀n␀g␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀g␀e␀n␀e␀r␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀a␀p␀p␀l␀i␀c␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀D␀R␀D␀O␀ ␀W␀o␀r␀k␀s␀h␀o␀p␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀p␀u␀l␀s␀i␀o␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀y␀s␀t␀e␀m␀s␀,␀ ␀H␀E␀M␀R␀L␀-␀P␀u␀n␀e␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀1␀5␀9␀-␀1␀6␀8␀ ␀(␀i␀n␀v␀i␀t␀e␀d␀ ␀p␀a␀p␀e␀r␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀5␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀a␀n␀e␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀K␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀M␀a␀r␀a␀t␀h␀e␀,␀ ␀A␀.␀G␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀2␀ ␀(␀J␀a␀n␀)␀,␀ ␀A␀n␀a␀l␀y␀s␀i␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀t␀h␀e␀r␀m␀o␀-␀f␀l␀u␀i␀d␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀i␀s␀s␀u␀e␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀f␀u␀e␀l␀ ␀c␀o␀o␀l␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀e␀l␀e␀c␀t␀r␀o␀n␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀a␀i␀r␀c␀r␀a␀f␀t␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀S␀y␀m␀p␀o␀s␀i␀u␀m␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀R␀e␀c␀e␀n␀t␀ ␀T␀r␀e␀n␀d␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀H␀e␀a␀t␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀M␀a␀s␀s␀ ␀T␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀I␀I␀T␀-␀G␀u␀w␀a␀h␀a␀t␀i␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀,␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀ ␀I␀S␀R␀T␀H␀M␀T␀ ␀0␀2␀-␀1␀2␀6␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀6␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀S␀a␀n␀e␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀K␀.␀,␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀M␀a␀r␀a␀t␀h␀e␀,␀ ␀A␀.␀G␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀J␀h␀a␀,␀ ␀A␀.␀K␀.␀,␀ ␀2␀0␀0␀0␀ ␀(␀S␀e␀p␀)␀,␀ ␀A␀n␀a␀l␀y␀t␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀i␀n␀v␀e␀s␀t␀i␀g␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀c␀a␀l␀i␀b␀r␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀n␀o␀n␀-␀l␀i␀n␀e␀a␀r␀i␀t␀y␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀b␀a␀l␀l␀-␀i␀n␀-␀v␀o␀r␀t␀e␀x␀ ␀f␀l␀o␀w␀m␀e␀t␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀G␀l␀o␀b␀a␀l␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀F␀l␀o␀w␀m␀e␀t␀e␀r␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀t␀r␀o␀l␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀M␀i␀l␀l␀e␀n␀n␀i␀u␀m␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀a␀l␀a␀k␀k␀a␀d␀-␀K␀e␀r␀a␀l␀a␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀1␀2␀7␀-␀1␀3␀4␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀7␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀T␀s␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀.␀P␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀9␀ ␀(␀O␀c␀t␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀A␀ ␀s␀u␀r␀v␀e␀y␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀c␀o␀u␀p␀l␀e␀d␀ ␀t␀r␀a␀n␀s␀p␀o␀r␀t␀ ␀p␀r␀o␀c␀e␀s␀s␀e␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀t␀h␀i␀n␀ ␀l␀i␀q␀u␀i␀d␀ ␀f␀i␀l␀m␀s␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀ ␀h␀e␀a␀t␀ ␀t␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀ ␀a␀p␀p␀l␀i␀c␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀C␀o␀l␀l␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀e␀r␀s␀:␀ ␀5␀t␀h␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀W␀o␀r␀k␀s␀h␀o␀p␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀I␀n␀v␀e␀s␀t␀i␀g␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀I␀C␀s␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀M␀i␀c␀r␀o␀s␀t␀r␀u␀c␀t␀u␀r␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀e␀-␀I␀t␀a␀l␀y␀ ␀(␀T␀I␀M␀A␀ ␀L␀a␀b␀,␀ ␀G␀r␀e␀n␀o␀b␀l␀e␀,␀ ␀F␀r␀a␀n␀c␀e␀)␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀5␀6␀-␀6␀2␀ ␀(␀f␀r␀o␀m␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀s␀i␀s␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀8␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀T␀s␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀.␀P␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀9␀ ␀(␀J␀u␀n␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀M␀u␀l␀t␀i␀m␀o␀d␀e␀ ␀h␀e␀a␀t␀ ␀t␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀a␀ ␀t␀w␀o␀-␀d␀i␀m␀e␀n␀s␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀a␀c␀i␀f␀i␀c␀ ␀R␀i␀m␀ ␀/␀ ␀A␀S␀M␀E␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀,␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀s␀o␀c␀i␀e␀t␀y␀ ␀E␀l␀e␀c␀t␀r␀o␀n␀i␀c␀ ␀P␀a␀c␀k␀a␀g␀i␀n␀g␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀M␀a␀u␀i␀-␀H␀a␀w␀a␀i␀i␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀ ␀(␀A␀S␀M␀E␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀)␀,␀ ␀V␀o␀l␀.␀ ␀2␀6␀-␀2␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀1␀2␀2␀9␀-␀1␀2␀3␀3␀ ␀(␀f␀r␀o␀m␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀s␀i␀s␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀1␀9␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀T␀s␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀.␀P␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀8␀ ␀(␀D␀e␀c␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀L␀a␀m␀i␀n␀a␀r␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀b␀e␀h␀a␀v␀i␀o␀u␀r␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀n␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀t␀h␀e␀r␀m␀a␀l␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀e␀n␀t␀r␀y␀ ␀l␀e␀n␀g␀t␀h␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀b␀e␀y␀o␀n␀d␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀I␀E␀E␀E␀ s␀ ␀2␀n␀d␀ ␀E␀l␀e␀c␀t␀r␀o␀n␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀P␀a␀c␀k␀a␀g␀i␀n␀g␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀T␀e␀c␀h␀n␀o␀l␀o␀g␀y␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀S␀i␀n␀g␀a␀p␀o␀r␀e␀ ␀(␀I␀E␀E␀E␀,␀ ␀P␀i␀s␀c␀a␀t␀a␀w␀a␀y␀,␀ ␀N␀J␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀)␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀1␀2␀6␀-␀1␀3␀2␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀(␀f␀r␀o␀m␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀s␀i␀s␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀0␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀T␀s␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀.␀P␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀8␀ ␀(␀S␀e␀p␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀N␀u␀m␀e␀r␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀i␀m␀u␀l␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀c␀o␀u␀p␀l␀e␀d␀ ␀f␀l␀o␀w␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀e␀v␀a␀p␀o␀r␀a␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀m␀e␀n␀i␀s␀c␀u␀s␀-␀d␀r␀i␀v␀e␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀v␀e␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀a␀n␀n␀u␀l␀a␀r␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀3␀r␀d␀ ␀H␀i␀g␀h␀ ␀P␀e␀r␀f␀o␀r␀m␀a␀n␀c␀e␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀o␀m␀p␀u␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀A␀s␀i␀a␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀ ␀S␀i␀n␀g␀a␀p␀o␀r␀e␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀7␀3␀2␀-␀7␀3␀9␀ ␀(␀f␀r␀o␀m␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀s␀i␀s␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀1␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀T␀s␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀.␀P␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀7␀ ␀(␀D␀e␀c␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀S␀e␀m␀i␀-␀a␀n␀a␀l␀y␀t␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀u␀d␀y␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀c␀o␀u␀p␀l␀e␀d␀ ␀h␀e␀a␀t␀ ␀t␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀f␀l␀o␀w␀ ␀d␀u␀e␀ ␀t␀o␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀e␀v␀a␀p␀o␀r␀a␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀m␀e␀n␀i␀s␀c␀u␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀ ␀a␀n␀n␀u␀l␀a␀r␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀ ␀e␀l␀e␀c␀t␀r␀o␀n␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀c␀o␀o␀l␀i␀n␀g␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀2␀n␀d␀ ␀I␀n␀t␀e␀r␀n␀a␀t␀i␀o␀n␀a␀l␀ ␀S␀e␀m␀i␀n␀a␀r␀ ␀o␀n␀ ␀F␀l␀u␀i␀d␀ ␀M␀e␀c␀h␀a␀n␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀H␀e␀a␀t␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀T␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀,␀ ␀D␀h␀a␀k␀a␀-␀B␀a␀n␀g␀l␀a␀d␀e␀s␀h␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀9␀-␀1␀6␀ ␀(␀f␀r␀o␀m␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀s␀i␀s␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀2␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀T␀s␀o␀,␀ ␀C␀.␀P␀.␀,␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀<␀b␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀b␀>␀,␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀7␀ ␀(␀D␀e␀c␀)␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀o␀u␀p␀l␀e␀d␀ ␀f␀l␀u␀i␀d␀ ␀f␀l␀o␀w␀ ␀&␀a␀m␀p␀;␀ ␀h␀e␀a␀t␀ ␀t␀r␀a␀n␀s␀f␀e␀r␀ ␀d␀u␀e␀ ␀t␀o␀ ␀a␀n␀ ␀e␀v␀a␀p␀o␀r␀a␀t␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀m␀e␀n␀i␀s␀c␀u␀s␀ ␀i␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀n␀n␀u␀l␀a␀r␀ ␀m␀i␀c␀r␀o␀c␀h␀a␀n␀n␀e␀l␀s␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀o␀c␀e␀e␀d␀i␀n␀g␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀7␀t␀h␀ ␀A␀s␀i␀a␀n␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀g␀r␀e␀s␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀F␀l␀u␀i␀d␀ ␀M␀e␀c␀h␀a␀n␀i␀c␀s␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀C␀h␀e␀n␀n␀a␀i␀ ␀(␀M␀a␀d␀r␀a␀s␀)␀-␀I␀n␀d␀i␀a␀,␀ ␀p␀p␀.␀ ␀7␀5␀7␀-␀7␀6␀0␀ ␀(␀f␀r␀o␀m␀ ␀P␀h␀D␀ ␀T␀h␀e␀s␀i␀s␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀3␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀3␀ ␀(␀A␀p␀r␀)␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀e␀d␀i␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀t␀r␀a␀n␀s␀m␀i␀s␀s␀i␀v␀i␀t␀y␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀t␀h␀e␀ ␀i␀n␀t␀e␀r␀v␀e␀n␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀a␀t␀m␀o␀s␀p␀h␀e␀r␀e␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀i␀n␀f␀r␀a␀r␀e␀d␀ ␀s␀i␀g␀n␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀s␀t␀u␀d␀i␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀S␀A␀E␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀A␀t␀l␀a␀n␀t␀i␀c␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀D␀a␀y␀t␀o␀n␀-␀O␀h␀i␀o␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀ ␀(␀S␀A␀E␀,␀ ␀W␀a␀r␀r␀e␀n␀d␀a␀l␀e␀,␀ ␀P␀A␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀)␀,␀ ␀S␀A␀E␀ ␀T␀e␀c␀h␀n␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀9␀3␀1␀4␀1␀3␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀4␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀2␀ ␀(␀A␀p␀r␀)␀,␀ ␀P␀r␀e␀d␀i␀c␀t␀i␀o␀n␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀e␀n␀g␀i␀n␀e␀ ␀c␀a␀s␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀t␀e␀m␀p␀e␀r␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀f␀i␀g␀h␀t␀e␀r␀ ␀a␀i␀r␀c␀r␀a␀f␀t␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀f␀o␀r␀ ␀i␀n␀f␀r␀a␀r␀e␀d␀ ␀s␀i␀g␀n␀a␀t␀u␀r␀e␀ ␀s␀t␀u␀d␀i␀e␀s␀,␀ ␀S␀A␀E␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀A␀t␀l␀a␀n␀t␀i␀c␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀D␀a␀y␀t␀o␀n␀-␀O␀h␀i␀o␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀ ␀(␀S␀A␀E␀,␀ ␀W␀a␀r␀r␀e␀n␀d␀a␀l␀e␀,␀ ␀P␀A␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀)␀,␀ ␀S␀A␀E␀ ␀T␀e␀c␀h␀n␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀9␀2␀0␀9␀6␀1␀(␀1␀-␀1␀0␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀l␀e␀f␀t␀:␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀&␀n␀b␀s␀p␀;␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀o␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀a␀r␀t␀=␀2␀5␀ ␀t␀y␀p␀e␀=␀1␀>␀␀
␀ ␀<␀l␀i␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀t␀o␀p␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀m␀a␀r␀g␀i␀n␀-␀b␀o␀t␀t␀o␀m␀-␀a␀l␀t␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀a␀u␀t␀o␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀l␀i␀s␀t␀:␀l␀2␀ ␀l␀e␀v␀e␀l␀1␀ ␀l␀f␀o␀7␀;␀t␀a␀b␀-␀s␀t␀o␀p␀s␀:␀l␀i␀s␀t␀ ␀.␀5␀i␀n␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀#␀E␀8␀E␀E␀F␀A␀'␀>␀<␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀M␀a␀h␀u␀l␀i␀k␀a␀r␀,␀ ␀S␀.␀ ␀P␀.␀ ␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀b␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀0␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀'␀>␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀1␀9␀9␀2␀ ␀(␀A␀p␀r␀)␀,␀ ␀P␀h␀i␀l␀o␀s␀o␀p␀h␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀a␀p␀p␀r␀o␀a␀c␀h␀ ␀t␀o␀ ␀t␀h␀e␀ ␀b␀a␀s␀i␀c␀ ␀u␀n␀d␀e␀r␀s␀t␀a␀n␀d␀i␀n␀g␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀t␀h␀e␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀m␀e␀c␀h␀a␀n␀i␀c␀s␀ ␀o␀f␀ ␀j␀e␀t␀ ␀p␀r␀o␀p␀u␀l␀s␀i␀o␀n␀,␀ ␀S␀A␀E␀ ␀A␀e␀r␀o␀s␀p␀a␀c␀e␀ ␀A␀t␀l␀a␀n␀t␀i␀c␀ ␀C␀o␀n␀f␀e␀r␀e␀n␀c␀e␀,␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀D␀a␀y␀t␀o␀n␀-␀O␀h␀i␀o␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀ ␀(␀S␀A␀E␀,␀ ␀W␀a␀r␀r␀e␀n␀d␀a␀l␀e␀,␀ ␀P␀A␀,␀ ␀U␀S␀A␀)␀,␀ ␀S␀A␀E␀ ␀T␀e␀c␀h␀n␀i␀c␀a␀l␀ ␀P␀a␀p␀.␀ ␀n␀o␀.␀␀
␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀ ␀9␀2␀0␀9␀6␀0␀(␀1␀-␀7␀)␀.␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀l␀i␀>␀␀
␀<␀/␀o␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀/␀d␀i␀v␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀/␀d␀i␀v␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀/␀d␀i␀v␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀/␀d␀i␀v␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀d␀i␀v␀ ␀i␀d␀=␀c␀l␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀w␀h␀i␀t␀e␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀1␀.␀0␀p␀t␀;␀␀
␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀H␀e␀l␀v␀e␀t␀i␀c␀a␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀␀
␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀3␀'␀>␀.␀ ␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀/␀d␀i␀v␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀d␀i␀v␀ ␀i␀d␀=␀f␀o␀o␀t␀e␀r␀>␀␀
␀␀
␀<␀p␀ ␀c␀l␀a␀s␀s␀=␀M␀s␀o␀N␀o␀r␀m␀a␀l␀ ␀a␀l␀i␀g␀n␀=␀c␀e␀n␀t␀e␀r␀ ␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀t␀e␀x␀t␀-␀a␀l␀i␀g␀n␀:␀c␀e␀n␀t␀e␀r␀;␀b␀a␀c␀k␀g␀r␀o␀u␀n␀d␀:␀w␀h␀i␀t␀e␀'␀>␀<␀s␀p␀a␀n␀␀
␀s␀t␀y␀l␀e␀=␀'␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀s␀i␀z␀e␀:␀7␀.␀5␀p␀t␀;␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀"␀C␀e␀n␀t␀u␀r␀y␀ ␀G␀o␀t␀h␀i␀c␀"␀,␀"␀s␀a␀n␀s␀-␀s␀e␀r␀i␀f␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀f␀a␀r␀e␀a␀s␀t␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀␀
␀"␀T␀i␀m␀e␀s␀ ␀N␀e␀w␀ ␀R␀o␀m␀a␀n␀"␀;␀m␀s␀o␀-␀b␀i␀d␀i␀-␀f␀o␀n␀t␀-␀f␀a␀m␀i␀l␀y␀:␀A␀r␀i␀a␀l␀;␀c␀o␀l␀o␀r␀:␀#␀4␀4␀4␀4␀4␀4␀'␀>␀C␀r␀e␀d␀i␀t␀s␀ ␀:␀ ␀W␀e␀b␀␀
␀D␀e␀v␀e␀l␀o␀p␀m␀e␀n␀t␀ ␀T␀e␀a␀m␀ ␀<␀b␀r␀>␀␀
␀␀ ␀2␀0␀1␀1␀ ␀I␀I␀T␀ ␀M␀a␀n␀d␀i␀ ␀A␀l␀l␀ ␀r␀i␀g␀h␀t␀s␀ ␀r␀e␀s␀e␀r␀v␀e␀d␀ ␀<␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀o␀:␀p␀>␀<␀/␀s␀p␀a␀n␀>␀<␀/␀p␀>␀␀

<div id="data_bottom">
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Research Interests: </h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Understanding the basic physics of correlated electron systems by using LDA, GGA, DFT+U, GW and LDA+DMFT based density functional theory.</li>
<li>Use of density functional theory in improving the functionality of the existing functional materials and designing the technologically important new materials.</li>

</ul></div></div>
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Academic Qualifications</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
 <li>M. Sc. (Physics) (2002): School of Physical Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi</li>
 <li>Ph. D. (Physics) (2007): UGC - DAE Consortium for Scientific Research, Indore, India</li></ul></div></div>
<div class="data_field">

<div class="data_field">
<h3>Awards and fellowship </h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Rashtriya Gramin Chhatrabriti-from classes VII to X</li>
<li>Merit Cum Means (MCM) Scholarship - M. Sc. </li>
<li>CSIR - NET in 2002</li>
</ul></div></div>

<div class="data field">
<h3>Employment</h3>
<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Visiting Fellow, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Mumbai, India (01 Mar. 2007 - 31 Sept. 2008)</li>
<li>Scientist - D, UGC - DAE Consortium for Scientific Research, Indore (01 Oct. 2008 -11 May 2012)</li>
<li>Visiting Assistant Professor, IIT Mandi, Mandi, India (14 May 2012 - present)</li>
</ul></div></div>

Phys. Rev. B <b>77</b>, 045123 (2008)</li>                                                               
<li>Doping and bond length contributions to Mn K-edge shift in 
La<sub>1-x</sub>Sr<sub>x</sub>MnO<sub>3</sub> (x = 0 - 0.7) and their correlation with electrical transport properties    <br>
<b>S. K. Pandey</b>, R. Bindu, A. Kumar, S. Khalid, and A. V. Pimpale<br>
Pramana J. Phys. <b>70</b>, 359 (2008)</li>

</ol>

<h5>2007</h5> 
<ol type="1,2">
<li>A study of transition metal K-edge x-ray absorption spectra of LaBO<sub>3</sub> (B = Mn, Fe, Co, Ni), La<sub>2</sub>CuO<sub>4</sub> and SrMnO<sub>3 </sub>using partial density of states<br>
<b>S. K. Pandey</b>, S. Khalid and A. V. Pimpale<br>
J. Phys.: Condens.  Matter <b>19</b>, 036212 (2007)</li>  
</ol>
<h5>2006</h5> 
<ol type="1,2">
<li>Local distortion in LaCoO<sub>3</sub> and PrCoO<sub>3</sub>: EXAFS, XRD and XANES studies<br>
<b>S. K. Pandey</b>, S. Khalid, N. P. Lalla, and A. V. Pimpale<br>
J. Phys.: Condens. Matter <b>18</b>, 10617 (2006)</li>
<li>                                           
Electronic states of LaCoO<sub>3</sub>: Co K-edge and La L-edge x-ray absorption studies<br><b>S. K. Pandey</b>, A. Kumar, S. Khalid, and A. V. Pimpale<br>
J. Phys.: Condens. Matter 1<b>8</b>, 7103 (2006)</li>
<li>                                         
Electronic states of PrCoO<sub>3</sub>: x-ray photoemission spectroscopy and LDA+U density of states studies<br>
<b>S. K. Pandey</b>, A. Kumar, S. M. Chaudhari, and A. V. Pimpale<br>
J. Phys.: Condens. Matter <b>18</b>, 1313 (2006)</li>                                                

</ol>


<h5>2005</h5> 
<ol type="1,2">
<li>Local distortion of MnO6 octahedron in La<sub>1-x</sub>Sr<sub>x</sub>MnO<sub>3+&sect;</sub> (x = 0.1 - 0.9): an EXAFS study<br>
R. Bindu, <b>S. K. Pandey</b>, A. Kumar, S. Khalid, and A. V. Pimpale<br>
J. Phys.: Condens. Matter <b>17</b>, 6393 (2005)</li>                                        
<li>Synthesis and investigation of structural and electronic properties of Pr<sub>1-x</sub>Ca<sub>x</sub>FeO<sub>3</sub><br> 
(x = 0 to 0.2) compound <b>S. K. Pandey</b>, R. Bindu, P. Bhatt, S. M. Chaudhari, and A. V. Pimpale<br>
Physica B <b>365</b>, 47 (2005)</li>
                                                                         

</ol>
<h4>b) Papers/Abstracts in Conferences, Symposia and Workshops</h4>


<ol type="1,2">
    
<li>Preparation and characterization of La<sub>1.85</sub>Sr<sub>0.15</sub>CuO<sub>4</sub> nano particles by ball milling <br>
V. Sathe and <b>S. K. Pandey</b><br>
Proc. DAE Solid State Physics Symposium <b>48</b>, 171 (2003) </li>
<li>
Rotational tunneling states in complex molecular systems<br>
<b>S. K. Pandey</b>, A. V. Pimpale and P. S. Goyal<br>
Proc. DAE Solid State Physics Symposium <b>49</b>, 594 (2004) </li>
<li>
Doping and bond length contributions to Mn K-edge shift in 
La<sub>1-x</sub>Sr<sub>x</sub>MnO<sub>3</sub> (x = 0 - 0.7) and their correlation with electrical transport properties <br>   
<b>S. K. Pandey</b>, R. Bindu, A. Kumar, S. Khalid, and A. V. Pimpale<br>

Proc. DAE Solid State Physics Symposium <b>53</b>, 971 (2008)</li>

<h3>Publications  </h3>
<div class="data">
<h2>I. ACADEMIC PUBLICATIONS (AUTHORED) </h2>
<h4>A. Books Published</h4>
<ul>

<li>Pruthviyallodagida Ghatavu Karnatakada Ninnegalu (In Kannada), Akshara Prakashana, Heggodu, 2009. </li>

</ul>
<h4>B. Articles Published</h4>
<ul>

<li>'Kartarana Kammata: Negilu, Neeravari Mattu Modala Ghattada Prabhutvagalu', (In Kannada), in M.V. Vasu (ed), Kannadadol Bhavisida Janapadam, Chinthana, Bangalore, 2009.</li>

<li>'Bhashe Pramanavadaga', (In Kannada), Kannada Sahitya Parishat Patrike, 88 (1-4), 2009.</li>

<li>'Itihasakara Ram Sharan Sharma', (In Kannada), Itihasa Darpana, 3, 2009.</li>

<li>'Shirapuresvara Charite', (In Kannada), Kannada Sahitya Parishat Patrike, 89 (1-2), 2010.</li>

<li>'The Ravaging Hand: Abdul Karim Khan and the Decline of Bijapur', Deccan Studies, 2010.</li>

<li>'Naane Khalandar Naane Khaleefa', (In Kannada), Itihasa Darpana, 4, 2010.</li>

<li>'Paparedddigala Prapancha', (In Kannada), Hosathu, December 2010.</li>

<li>'Pullaragimathada Mallikarjunana Dakshinamurthy Stotra', (In Kannada), Kannada Sahitya Parishat Patrike, 89 (3-4) and 90 (1-2), 2010-11.</li>

<li>'Narcissus and His Empire: The Trajectory of Desire in Malayalam Cinema', Journal of South Indian History, 3 (1), 2011.</li>

<li>'Nadu Nudigala Adhyayana', (In Kannada), Lokajnana (The Triennial Journal of Tumkur University), 1 (1), 2013.</li>

<li>'Abraham bin Yiju', (In Kannada), Itihasa Darpana, 17, 2013.</li>

</ul>

</ul>

<h4>A. Books Published</h4>

<h2>C. Books Accepted for Publication</h2>

<div id="data_bottom">
<div class="data_field">
<h3>Research interests</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li> Artificial intelligence and cognitive modeling (modeling human behavior in dynamic tasks through computer algorithms)</li>
<li> Human-Computer Interaction (the study of interaction between people and computers)</li>
<li> Environmental decision making (understanding human behavior in environmental problems)</li>
<li> Judgment and decision making (understanding human behavior in problems involving risk and uncertainty)</li>
<li> Situation awareness (recognition, comprehension, and projection of a situation in the decision environment)</li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>

<li><b>Dutt, V.</b>, & Gonzalez, C. (2012).<br>
   Decisions from experience reduces misconceptions about climate change. Journal of Environment Psychology, 32(1), 19-29. doi: 10.1016/j.jenvp.2011.10.003</li>

<li><b>Dutt, V.</b>, & Gonzalez, C. (2011).<br> 
  Human Control of Climate. Climatic Change, 111(3-4), 497-518. doi: 10.1007/s10584-011-0202-x</li>

<li><b>Dutt, V.</b>  (2011).<br> 
  Explaining Human Behavior in Dynamic Tasks through Reinforcement Learning. Journal of Advances in Information Technology, 2(3), 177-188. doi:10.4304/jait.2.3.177-188</li>

<li><b>Dutt, V.</b>, Young-Suk, A., & Gonzalez, C. (2011). <br>
  Cyber Situation Awareness: Modeling the Security Analyst in a Cyber-Attack Scenario through Instance-Based Learning. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, 6818, 280-292. doi: 10.1007/978-3-642-22348-8_24</li>

<li><b>Dutt, V.</b>, & Gonzalez, C. (2011).<br> 
  Why do we want to delay actions on climate change? Effects of probability and timing of climate consequences. Journal of Behavioral Decision Making, 25, 154-164. doi: 10.1002/bdm.721</li>

<li>Gonzalez, C. & <b>Dutt, V.</b>  (2011).<br>
   Instance-based Learning: Integrating Sampling and Repeated Decisions from Experience. Psychological Review, 118(4), 523-551. doi: 10.1037/a0024558</li>

<li>Gonzalez C., <b>Dutt, V.</b>, & Lejarraga T. (2011).<br> 
  A Loser Can Be a Winner: Comparison of Two Instance-based Learning Models in a Market Entry Competition. Games, 2(1), 136-162. doi: 10.3390/g2010136</li>

<li>Gonzalez, C., & <b>Dutt, V.</b>  (2011).<br> A Generic Dynamic Control Task for Behavioral Research and Education. Computers in Human Behavior, 27, 1904–1914.<br> doi: 10.1016/j.chb.2011.04.015</li>

<li>Lejarraga, T., <b>Dutt, V.</b>, & Gonzalez, C. (2010).<br> Instance-based learning: A general model of repeated binary choice. Journal of Behavioral Decision Making, 25, 143-153. doi: 10.1002/bdm.722</li>
<li>Young, M. D., Healy, A. F., Gonzalez, C., <b>Dutt, V.</b>, & Bourne, L. E. (2010).<br> 
  Effects of training with added difficulties on RADAR detection. Applied Cognitive Psychology, 24, 1-22. doi: 10.1002/acp.1706</li>

</ul>

<h2 class="page_heading"> Balasundaram Subramanian </h2>

<div id="data_container">

<div id="data">

<div id="data_top">

<img src="images/bsubramanian.jpg" width="150" height="200"  alt="Dr. B. Subramanian"/>



<div id="contact_info">

<table>

</tr>

<tr>

<th>Address: </th>	<td>Professor of German Studies &  Head,</td>

</tr>
<tr><th></th><td> School of Humanities & Social Sciences</td></tr>

<div id="data_bottom">

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Research Interests</h3>

<div class="data">
  <ul><li>Rilke- and Kassner-Studies</li>
<li>Weimar Classicism</li>
<li>Indian Writing in English</li>

</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Education</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Ph.D in German Studies in 1981: [Prof. S.B.Shrotri (Karnatak) and Prof. Jacob Steiner (Karlsruhe)]</li>
<li>Masters in German Studies in 1977</li>
<li>Graduate Studies at the Department of Studies in Foreign Languages, Karnatak University Dharwad from 1975 to 1981.</li>
<li>DAAD-Sandwich Scholar from 1979 to 1981 at the Inst. f. Literaturwissenschaft, University of Karlsruhe</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div>

<div class="data_field">

<h3>Academic Positions</h3>

<div class="data"><ul>
<li>	August, 2011-  : Professor & Head, School of Humanities and Social Sciences, IIT Mandi.</li>
<li>	Lecturer in German at the Madras Christian College Madras from 1973 till 1984. </li>
<li>	Joined the Department of Humanities & Social Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Madras in Jan 1985 as Lecturer. Appointed Assistant Professor in 1990, Associate Professor (German Studies & European Philosophy) in 1995, Professor in 2000.</li>
<li>	2008-2011: Professor, Centre of German Studies, School of Language, Literature & Cultural Studies, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi.</li>

</ul></div>

</div>

<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Related Professional Activities</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Visiting Professor, Dept. of Linguistics & Literature, University of Bielefeld (2010).</li>
<li>	Visiting Professor, Dept. of Germanic Language and Literature Studies, University of Jena (2007,2009).</li>
<li>	Visiting Professor, Dept. of Philosophy, University of Dresden (2005, 2006).</li>
<li>	Exchange Programme Advisor, Dept. of Political Management, Hochschule Bremen (2000-2006).</li>
<li>	Member of several university boards of studies; course advisor to the Indian Institute of Information Technology & Management at Gwalior (2002-2005); Vice-President and Editor, Goethe Society of India.</li>

</ul>
</div>

</div>


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Professional  Associations</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Member, International Association for Germanic Studies (IVG)</li>
<li>Member, International Rilke-Gesellschaft; </li>
<li>Member, International Goethe-Gesellschaft, </li>
<li>Vice-President, Goethe Society of India</li>
<li>Member, International Association for Germanic Studies (IVG)</li>
<li>Member, Advisory Board of 'STARS', Journal of the Humanities and Social Sciences</li>
<li>Member, Editorial Board of the Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India</li>
<li>Member, Editorial Board, German Studies in India</li>
<li>Member, Editorial Board of Yavanika, Journal of Indo-Hellenic Studies</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div>

<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Distinctions</h3>

<div class="data">

<b>DAAD Scholar:</b><ul> <li>1979-1981 at University of Karlsruhe: Prof.Dr. Jacob Steiner</li>
<li>1986 at the University of Karlsruhe: Prof.Dr. Jacob Steiner/ University of
Erlangen-Nürnberg: Prof.Dr. Ulrich Fülleborn</li></ul> <b>
UGC Visiting Fellow (1984) at Karnatak University Dharwad<br>
Alexander von Humboldt-Fellow:</b>
<ul>
<li>1991-1992 at University of Karlsruhe: Prof.Dr. Jacob Steiner</li>
<li>2004 at University of Dresden: Prof.Dr. Bernhard Irrgang</li>
<li>2007 at University of Jena: Prof.Dr. Klaus Manger</li>
<li>2009 at University of Jena: Prof. Dr. Klaus Manger</li>
<li>2010 at University of Bielefeld: Prof.Dr. Wolfgang Braungart</li>
</ul>
<b>Fellow of the Weimar Classics Foundation, 2005 & 2008<br>
Fellow of the Goethe Society Weimar 2006</b>



</div>

</div>


<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Teaching</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>German Studies</li>
<li>Political Philosophy</li>
<li>Rhetoric</li>

</ul>
</div>

<div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Publications</h3>
<div class="data">
<div>
<ul type="1"><li> <div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Books</h3>

<div class="data">
<ul><li>Engel und Mensch. Studien zu Rilkes Duineser Elegien. Bern/Frankfurt a.M./New York 1986 (Peter Lang). (European University Series, Series 1, vol. 917)</li></ul>
</div>
</div>


  </li>
<li><div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Edited Publications </h3>
<div class="data">

<ul> 
<li>(Ed.) Indien im Spiegel der deutschen Dichtung. Vol.17, Proceedings of the International Association for German Studies. Warsaw Congress 2010, Frankfurt a.M./ New York 2012 (Pete, Lang)</li>
<li>(Ed.)   Yearbook 2001-2002 of the Goethe Society of India, Madras 2003.</li>
<li>(Ed.)   Yearbook 1999-2000 of the Goethe Society of India, Madras 2000.</li>
<li>(Ed.)  Yearbook 1998 of the Goethe Society of India, Madras 1999.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div></li>
<li><div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Principal Publications <font size="1">(Listed thematically)</font></h3>
<div class="data">
<h5>Rilke and Kassner Studies</h5>
<p align="justify">
<ul>
<li>Der “Artischockenboden ist für mich Benares...“ Die Vision der Stadt bei Rilke. Vol.17, Proceedings of the International Association for German Studies. Warsaw Congress 2010, Frankfurt a.M./ New York 2012 (Peter Lang).</li>
<li>Hier ist des Säglichen Zeit.” Zeit als Imperativ bei Rilke. In: Phänomen Zeit. Dimensionen und Strukturen in Kultur und Wissenschaft. Ed. Dietmar Goltschnigg. Tübingen  (Stauffenberg) 2011</li>
<li>Was hat Paris mit Benares zu tun? Raja Raos topophilische Replik auf Rilkes Malte. German Studies in India. Aktuelle Beiträge aus der indischen Germanistik. Eds. Thomas Schwarz & Shaswati Mazumdar. München (Iudicium) 2008.</li>
<li>History as Form.  Rudolf Kassners Physiognomic View of the Eidos of History.  In: Yavanika. Indo-Hellenic Studies, vol. 11/2008.</li>
<li>Zwischen Maß und Maßlosigkeit. Zur physiognomischen Kulturphilosophie Rudolf Kassners. In: German Studies in India. Aktuelle Beiträge aus der indischen Germanistik. Ed. Dorothea Jecht & Shaswati Mazumdar. München 2006.</li>
<li>Die Umkehr als der Maßbegriff. Rudolf Kassners Entwürfe  zu einer physiognomischen  Geschichtsphilosophie.   In: Rudolf Kassner, Physiognomik als Wissensform. Ed. Gerhard Neumann & Ulrich Ott. Freiburg i.Br. (Rombach, Reihe Litterae, vol. .65) 1999.</li>
<li>Der Weg zur Innigkeit.  Zur Konstellation Rilke-Kassner-Tagore. In:Jahrbuch für Internationale Germanistik. Jahrgang XXIX, Heft 2. Bern/Berlin 1997.</li>
<li>Rainer Maria Rilke und die Stadt. In: Rainer Maria Rilke und die Schweiz. Ed. Jacob Steiner. Berlin (AkademieVerlag) 1992.</li>
<li>Zur Überwindung der Chandos-Krise: Beispiel Rilke, Beispiel Valéry, German Studies in India. Vol.XI/3.  Trivandrum (University of Kerala) 1987.</li>
<li>Der "Überfall auf das Unsagbare". Zur anamnetischen Struktur der Dichtung Rilkes. In: Im Dialog mit der Moderne. Ed. R.Jost und H.Schmidt-Bergmann. Frankfurt a.M. (Athenäum )1986.</li>
<li>Der Handlungsbegriff bei Rilke. In: Spektrum. Festschrift für Prof.B.B.Kulkarni. Poona 1984. </li>
<li>Die "Wendung". Zum Einfluß Tagores auf Rilke. Karnatak University Journal of Humanities. Vol.XVIII/ 1983-84. Dharwad 1984.</li>
<li>Rilkes Duineser Elegien aus neuer Sicht. In: German Studies in India. Vol.VI/3&4, 1982 &Vol.VII/41983. Trivandrum (University of Kerala).</li>
      </ul></p>
   
    <p align="justify"><h5>Weimar Classicism</h5></p>

      <ul >
       <li> Shakespeares Adieu und Wielands Debüt.  Zu Christoph Martin Wielands Übersetzung des Tempest.  In: Wieland-Studien VII.  Ed. Klaus Manger Heidelberg 2012. </li>
<li>Goethes Apologie für die Dichtkunst. Über das Urtheater zu Beginn des Faust.  In: Faust I und kein Ende. Studien zu Goethes Werk. Ed. Árpad Bernáth. Szeged (Grimm Verlag) 2012.</li>
<li>Alexander von Humboldt’s Travelogue.  A „Convenient Vehicle for Miscellaneous Discussions“? Journey as Philosopheme in Humboldt and Darwin. In: "Cosmos, Cosmopolitanism, Cosmopolitics: From Alexander von Humboldt Until Today".  Ed. Soraya Nour Sckell. Berlin, Duncker & Humblot, 2012. </li>
<li>Die „kleine, dann die große Welt“.  Das Urtheater als Schlüssel zur naturwissenschaftlichen Methode Goethes und Alexander von Humboldts. In: Goethe, Grabbe und die Pflege der Literatur. Festschrift für Lothar Ehrlich. Eds. Holger Dainat & Burkhard Stenzel. Mit einer Einleitung von Paul Raabe. Bielefeld (Aisthesis) 2008.</li>
<li>Das „Faustische“ im Spiegel des Machtkampfes zwischen den Devas und Asuras. In: Orient und Okzident. Zur Faustrezeption in nicht-christlichen Kulturen.  Eds. Jochen Golz & Adrian Hsia. Weimar (Boehlau) 2008.</li>
<li>The Theatre as the Laboratory of the World.  Goethe’s Response to the Paradigm Shift in Modern Science. STARS 1/2, 2007.</li>
<li>Die „Ästhetischen Briefe“ als Fürstenspiegel der politischen Moderne. Zum Einfluß Edmund Burkes auf Friedrich Schiller. In: Schiller, der unterschätzte Theoretiker. Eds. Lothar Ehrlich & Georg Bollenbeck, Weimar 2006.</li>
<li>The Future of the Aesthetic Education of Man.  The Seven New Liberal Arts in the Spirit of Alexander von Humboldt’s Political Study of Mexico. In: Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India 2006. Delhi 2006.</li>
<li>Das Reisen als Erkenntnisgewinn.  Wielands Agathon und die Anfänge der politischen Philosophie in Deutschland. In: Wieland-Studien V. Ed. Klaus Manger. Heidelberg 2005.</li>
<li>Goethe and the Vision of Wisdom. In: Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India 1999-2000.</li>
<li>The Quest and the Conquest. Alexander von Humboldt’s Concept of Science.  In: Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India 1999-2000. Madras 2001.</li>
<li>Goethe’s World-Literature in the Context of Modernity. In: Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India 1998.Madras1999.</li>
<li>The “Negro Recipe”. Heine versus Goethe. In: Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India 1998. Madras 1999.</li>
<li>Otto Schraders Beitrag zur Verständigung Goethes in Indien. In: German Studies in India. Vol.VI/4.  Trivandrum (University of Kerala) 1982.</li>
      </ul>
    
    <p align="justify"><h5>India  and Indian Writing in English</h5></p>

      <ul>
        <li>Die “poetische Poesie”: Globalisierung im Spannungsfeld zwischen Tradition und Geschichte.  Der Historiker als Romanheld bei Raja Rao und Arundhati Roy. In: Indien im Blick. Ed. Ursula Kocher.  Berne/Berlin (Peter Lang) 2012.</li>
   <li>Anarchist Apartheid, Towards a Study of Indian Uni-Pluralism. In: Yearbook of the Goethe Society of India 2000-2001. Madras 2003.  </li>
   <li>Geschichte versus Grand  Story. Zum Roman ‘Der Gott der kleinen Dinge’ von Arundhati Roy. In: Globalisierung und Identität.  Fu-Jen University Publication. Taiwan 2001.</li>
   <li>India’s Cultural Relationships with Germany. In: India and Germany in a Changing World.  Ed. G.Kueck&R.K.Jain. New Delhi (Radiant Books) 2001.</li>
   <li>Translating Cultural Key-Concepts. The Example of Indian Writing in English. In: KulturelleIdentität. Deutsch-indische Kulturkontakte in Literatur, Politik und Religion. Ed. H.Turk &A. Bhatti. Berlin (Erich Schmidt Verlag) 1997.</li>
   <li>A President of India, Made in Germany. Indian Students in Berlin between the two World Wars. In: Die Me[h]rfahrt, 5/2007.</li>

</ul>
<p>
<h5>Translations</h5>
<ul>

<li>RomilaThapar, Die Tyrannei der Etikettierung, in: Indien in der Gegenwart, Vol.II/1-2/1997.</li>
<li>Bertolt Brecht: The Beast. In: Journal of the School of Languages, JNU, New Delhi 2008.</li>

</ul>
</p>
</div></div></li>
<li><div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Miscellaneous Publications</h3>
<div class="data">
     <ul>
     <li>Der ‘Heimatbrief eines Europäers’. Der essayistische Beitrag Stefan Zweigs zum
europäischen Gedanken. In: Studia Germania Naocensia, 2/2010. Ed. Rudolf Gräf.
Klausenburg 2012.</li>
<li> Über eine Bemerkung in Goethes „Divan“. In: Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 4.11.2009.</li>
<li>Schule am Abgrund. Zu den verlorenen Werten und Werkzeugen unserer Schulkultur. In: Grenzüberschreitungen. Didaktische Anregungen durch interdisziplinäre Seminare mit deutschsprachigen Lehramtsstudierenden. Ed. Ute Michailowitsch, Mirona Stănescu& Gabriella-NóraTar. Klausenburg/Freiburg. 2009.</li>
<li>Internationalisierung des Bildungswesen im Zeichen der Globalisierung. Die „Nomistik“ als Antwort auf die globale Herausforderung. In: Grenzüberschreitungen. Didaktische Anregungen durch interdisziplinäre Seminare mit deutschsprachigen Lehramtsstudierenden. Ed. Ute Michailowitsch, MironaStănescu& Gabriella-NóraTar. Klausenburg, Freiburg. 2009.</li>
<li>Treffen sich zwei Wissenschaftslegenden. (Review Article of Daniel Kehlmann’s „Die Vermessung der Welt“). Humboldt Kosmos, 89/2007.</li>
<li>Heine, the Romantic Renegade, in: "The Hindu", 26.12.1997.</li>
<li>Memory and the Poetic Mode, Journal of Indian Writing in English, vol.18/2, 1990.</li>
<li>Robert Pattison: On Literacy, GSI, vol X/I, 1986. (Review article).</li>
<li>Zu Robert Musils "Drei Frauen", (with S.B.Shrotri), KarnatakUniverity Journal of Humanities,vol.XIX, 1985.</li>
<li>Homage to Heinrich Böll, Kulturgespräch, Manipal, vol.XVI, 1985.</li>
<li>SolothurnerLiteraturtage 1980. GSI, Vol.VI/I& 2,1982. (Review Article).</li>
<li>Zug, Mensch und Gott: Über Wolfenstein und Stadler. GSI, Vol. I/8, 1977.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li><div class="data_field large_df">
<h3>Some Conference Papers <font size="1"> (2001-2011)</font></h3>

<div class="data">
<ul>
<li>Common Sense, Reason and Rationality in Politics. AvH Collegium on ‘Self Organized Criticality. Dynamics of Complex Systems’. Bangalore, Feb 2011.</li>
<li>Hat die multikulturelle Gesellschaft versagt? Zu den Grenzen des Pluralismus. AvH Collegium on ‘Knowledge, Culture and Science’. Timisoara, November 2010.</li>
<li>The Political Philosophy of Eric Voegelin. Collège Humboldt: ‘Incertitude et créativité. Réflexions sur les pratiques scientifiques’. L'Université d'Evry-Val-d'Essonne. Paris, June 2010.</li>
<li>Humanities  in Crisis. Program of the Academic Staff College, JNU for College Principals,  October 2009.</li>
        <li>Der  „Artischocken-Boden ist für mich Benares[…]“ – Benares als  politikphilosophisches Substrat in der Dichtung Rilkes.&nbsp; Seminar  on „India in German Literature“. Benares Hindu University, September 2009. </li>
        <li>“Hier ist des Säglichen Zeit.” Zeit als Imperativ bei Rilke. Humboldt Kolleg: Phänomen Zeit. Graz 2009.</li>
        <li>Alexander  von Humboldt’s Travelogue.&nbsp; A „Convenient  Vehicle for Miscellaneous Discussions“? Journey as Philosopheme in Humboldt and  Darwin. College Humboldt of the Centre Marc Bloch Berlin; Paris, June 2009. [Forthcoming  Publication]</li>
        <li>Vertrauen durch Netzwerkbildung.  Alumni-Vereinigungen weltweit. Keynote Address. AvH Conference. Berlin, January 2009. (Published in the "Discussion Papers" of The Autt-Fodundation).</li>

       <li>Schule am Abgrund.&nbsp; Zu den verlorenen Werten und Werkzeugen  unserer Schulkultur. Inaugural Address of the VIII. International Klausenburg  Kongreß zur Kinder und Jugendkultur. Klausenburg, March 2009. (In Print)</li>
        <li>Zur Internationalisierung des  Bildungswesens im Zeichen der Globalisierung.&nbsp;  Die „Nomistik“ als Antwort auf die globale Herausforderung.&nbsp; Klausenburg, March&nbsp; 2009. (In Print)</li>
        <li>Der Europa-Gedanke in der  Essaystik Stefan Zweigs. Österreichische Bibliothek. Babes-Bolyai University,  Klausenburg. March 2009.</li>

        <li>The Role  of Language in Technical Education. Keynote Address. Conference on Pedagogical  Tools for Knowledge Management.&nbsp; TEQIP,  Jadavapur University, Kolkatta, March 2009.</li>
        <li>Numeracy  or Literacy. Rediscovering the Lost Tools of Learning. Key-Note Address. AvH  Conference on Engineering Education. New Delhi, Nov 2008.</li>
      <li>Das “Echte bleibt der Nachwelt  unverloren.” Inaugural Address at  the Annual Congress of the Goethe Society of Hungary. Szeged, Oct 2008. </li>
        <li>Democracy  and Nationalism in Historical Perspective.&nbsp;  Valedictory Address. Conference on Regional Challenges in South-East  Asia. Pondicherry University,Mar 2008</li>
     
        <li>Der  erstaunliche Schiffbruch,&nbsp; Zu Christoph  Martin Wielands Shakespeare-Übersetzung, International Seminar on „Translation  as Cultural Praxis“, Goethe Society of India,&nbsp;  University of Pune, November 2006 (In Print). </li>

        <li>Das  „Faustische“ im Spiegelbild des Machtkampfes zwischen den Devas und Asuras, Zum  Symphronismus Goethes, Conference on the Reception of Goethe’s „Faust“ in  non-Christian cultures, McGill University, Montreal, Oct 2006 (In Print).</li>
       <li>Die  „poetische Poesie“ – Globalisierung zwischen Tradition und Geschichte,  Conference on „Indien im deutschsprachigen Europa“, Freie Universität Berlin,Oct 2006 (In Print)</li>
      
        <li>Inaugural  Address: “ The Charkha of Technology and the Chakra of Politics, Towards a New  Brihadaaranyakaa” and Keynote Address:&nbsp;  “The State of Nature and the Nature of the State”, Aesthetics as  Predictive Political Art”, UGC sponsored National Seminar on “Eco-Textuality  and its Textual Echoes”, jointly organized by Periyar Foundation Thekkady and  St.Thomas College, Pala at Periyar Foundation, Thekkady, March 2006.</li>
        <li>“Was  hat Benares mit Paris zu tun? – Raja Raos topophilische Replik auf Rilkes <em>Malte</em>), XI. Congress of the International Association for  Germanic Studies (IVG) held at the University of Sorbonne, Paris, Section 26:  Paris as Cultural Metropolis, August 2005 (As Abstract in Conference  Proceedings.)</li>
       <li>“Auch eine  schöne Jejend…die indische Germanistik”,&nbsp;  Colloquium on German Studies in India jointly organized by the Dept. of  German Studies, Freie Universität Berlin, DAAD and Alexander von  Humboldt-Foundation,&nbsp; August 2005.</li>

        <li>Christoph  Martin Wielands politisch-philosophischer Ansatz im Zeichen des klassischen  Liberalismus, Foundation Weimar Classics and Art Collections, Weimar, May 2005.</li>
        <li>The  Politics of Schiller’s Aesthetics, Symposium on Friedrich Schiller and Annual  Convention of the Goethe Society of India, Centre of German Studies, Jawaharlal  Nehru University, New Delhi, March 2005.</li>
        <li>The  Poetics of the State – Stefan Zweig’s Vision of Europe, National&nbsp; Symposium and Workshop on European Union  Studies, IIT Madras, Madras, Feb 2005.</li>
        <li>Green card  versus Greenback, Indo-German Media Dialogue, Ministry of External Affairs,  Federal Republic of Germany, Berlin, September 2003. (As Abstract in Conference  Proceedings.)</li>
       <li>Die  Vermittlung der Moderne im Deutschunterricht für Fortgeschrittene,  International German Language Teachers’ Congress (IDT), Lucerne, August 2001.  (As Abstract in Conference Proceedings.)</li>
<li>Indiens  kulturelle Beziehungen mit Deutschland, German-Indian Dialogue, Konrad Adenauer  Foundation, Bonn-Bad Godesberg, June 2001. (As Abstract in Conference  Proceedings.)</li></ul>

␀<␀m␀e␀t␀a␀ ␀h␀t␀t␀p␀-␀e␀q␀u␀i␀v␀=␀"␀r␀e␀f␀r␀e␀s␀h␀"␀ ␀c␀o␀n␀t␀e␀n␀t␀=␀"␀0␀;␀ ␀u␀r␀l␀=␀h␀t␀t␀p␀s␀:␀/␀/␀s␀i␀t␀e␀s␀.␀g␀o␀o␀g␀l␀e␀.␀c␀o␀m␀/␀s␀i␀t␀e␀/␀s␀u␀m␀a␀n␀s␀i␀g␀r␀o␀h␀a␀/␀"␀ ␀/␀>␀

<div id ="left_column">



<h2 class="page_heading">Dr. Manoj Thakur </h2>

<div id="data_container">

<div id="data">

<div id="data_top">

<img src="images/manoj.jpg" alt="Dr. Manoj Thakur "/>



<div id="contact_info">
